completio: <entryFree id="n9617" type="main" key="comple_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compleo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n9617.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A filling</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 105, 2</bibl> Müll.; Jul. Ep. Nov. c. 66, § 234.—</sense><sense id="n9617.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A filling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulfilment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctae prophetiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 161" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
completivus: <entryFree id="n9618" type="main" key="comple_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complētīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for filling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completive</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">particula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1026</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
completor: <entryFree id="n9619" type="hapax" key="comple_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complētor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fills up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fulfiller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum (Jesus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> in Matt. 2, 12, v. 574</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
completorium: <entryFree id="n9620" type="main" key="comple_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complētōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a service containing prayers at the close of the day</hi> (eccl. Lat.): completorii hora, Hymn. de Pass. Domin.</sense></entryFree>
completus: <entryFree id="n9621" type="main" key="comple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>compleo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
complex: <entryFree id="n9622" type="main" key="complex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complex</orth>, <itype>plĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>complico</etym>, <sense id="n9622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">closely connected with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participant</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dii consentes et complices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>agreeing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 123</bibl></cit> (v. consentes).— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 4, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 614</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complexio: <entryFree id="n9623" type="main" key="complexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complexĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>complector</etym> (Ciceron.), <sense id="n9623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a combination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9623.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9623.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(atomorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—Of the zodiac, App. de Mundo, p. 57, 37.—</sense><sense id="n9623.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in late Lat., for <hi rend="ital">a physical constitution</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>: bona, Firm. Math. 5, 9.—</sense><sense id="n9623.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9623.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a combination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">association</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulata bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9623.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9623.7" n="1" level="3"> Of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis totius negotii,</quote> <trans><tr>comprehension</tr>, <tr>comprisal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9623.8" n="2" level="3"> T. t. </sense><sense id="n9623.9" n="a" level="4"> In rhet. </sense><sense id="n9623.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longissima est igitur complexio verborum, quae volvi uno spiritu potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec acervatim multa frequentans unā complexione devinciet,</quote> <trans><tr>crowd into one period</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9623.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorical figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to which</hi> <pb n="391" /> <cb n="COMP" /> <hi rend="ital">one constantly recurs to what has been previously said</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9623.12" n="b" level="4"> In philos. lang. </sense><sense id="n9623.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A conclusion in a syllogism</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:37:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 37, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 5 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9623.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A dilemma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 29, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Div. in Caecil. 14:45" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9623.15" n="c" level="4"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a contraction of two syllables into one</hi>, for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sunai/resis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">sunaloifh/</foreign> (opp. divisio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complexivus: <entryFree id="n9624" type="main" key="complexi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complexīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>complector</etym>; in gram., <sense id="n9624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for connecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conneclive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copulative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">particula (atque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 29</bibl></cit> tit. (in the text itself, conexiva): <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 272</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plexīvē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complexo: <entryFree id="n9625" type="main" key="complexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complexo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>complecto = complector</etym>, <sense id="n9625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clasp around</hi> (post-class. and rare), Coripp. 1, 104: <cit><quote lang="la">artissime complexatum aliquem recipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complexor: <entryFree id="n9626" type="main" key="complexor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complexor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to embrace closely</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 10, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complexus: <entryFree id="n9627" type="main" key="complexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from complector.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9628" type="main" key="complexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complexus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>complector</etym>, <sense id="n9628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surrounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embracing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9628.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9628.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9628.3" n="1" level="3"> Of things (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aether Omnia avido complexu cetera saepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 471</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1066" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1066</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (mundus) omnia complexu suo coërcet et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 40, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides alligati complexu silicis,</quote> <trans><tr>by a binding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9628.4" n="2" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">secutae conlocutiones cum Trebonio complexusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e complexu parentum abreptos filios ad necem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi complexu coierunt membra tenaci,</quote> <trans><tr>in a mutual close embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complexu matris avellere natam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:118" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:68" default="NO">8, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerio,</quote> <trans><tr>in copulation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 69, 143</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> S, 1, 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 742</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 388</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 249</bibl>.—Rarely (like complector itself), of <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi> embrace, <hi rend="ital">close combat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Martis complexu cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a serpent: longis amplexibus illos necat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctari complexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9628.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a measure, <hi rend="ital">the reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cedrus) crassitudinis ad trium hominum conplexum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9628.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9628.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A connection in discourse</hi> (very freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitium non est in sensu, sed in complexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in complexu loquendi serieque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum aliorumque scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:57" default="NO">7, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, personarum, temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n9628.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A friendly embracing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectionate relation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">venisti in sinum et complexum tuae mimulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica Pompeii filium suo sinu complexuque recipiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius gentis humanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu easdem artes in complexu, oculis, auribus habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complicabilis: <entryFree id="n9629" type="main" key="compli^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>complico</etym>, <sense id="n9629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be folded together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complicatio: <entryFree id="n9630" type="main" key="compli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9630.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A folding together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enveloping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9630.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A multiplication</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">denaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 1</bibl></cit>, n. 19.</sense></entryFree>
complico: <entryFree id="n9631" type="main" key="compli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (postAug. ui, ĭtum; cf.: applico, explico, etc.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fold together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fold up</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9631.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes se complicuit in dolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus complicitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">complicitus in genua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 111, 3. —* </sense><sense id="n9631.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis voluerit animi sui complicatam notionem evolvere (the figure borrowed from the folding together of books, letters, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complodo: <entryFree id="n9632" type="main" key="complo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plōdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>plaudo</etym>: manus, <sense id="n9632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clap the hands together in applauding</hi>, from joy, pain, etc. (only in <cb n="COMP" /> post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">complodere manus scaenicum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 123</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comploratio: <entryFree id="n9633" type="main" key="complo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complōrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comploro</etym>, <sense id="n9633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi>, esp. by several persons (several times in Liv., elsewhere rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): lamentabilis mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 9, 7</bibl>; 41, 11, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl>.—Of one person: <cit><quote lang="la">sororis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9633.1" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">obj. -gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loud. violent bemoaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewailing of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus... et conploratio sui patriaeque fregere tandem virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei acerbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comploratus: <entryFree id="n9634" type="main" key="complo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complōrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. comploratio, <sense id="n9634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent moaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi>, etc., esp. of several persons (only in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">familiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 55, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 42, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justo conploratu prosequi mortuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 26, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comploro: <entryFree id="n9635" type="main" key="complo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bewail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament together loudly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violently</hi> (rare, and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:95" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vivi mortuique promiscue complorarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 55, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperata et complorata respublica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 53, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum morte comploratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:37:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 37, 98</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comploratum publice est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
complosus: <entryFree id="n9636" type="main" key="complo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from complodo.</entryFree>
compluit: <entryFree id="n9637" type="main" key="complu^it"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complŭit</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n9637.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in raining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā compluebat compluvium (dictum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n9637.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rain upon;</hi> hence, as a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: compluor, complutus sum, ŭi, <hi rend="ital">to be rained upon</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. 1:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 10, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complures: <entryFree id="n9638" type="main" key="complu_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-plūres</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>a, and</itype> (mostly ante-class.) ia; <sense id="n9638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ium (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 6</bibl>; Charis. pp. 56 and 100 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 6</bibl> Don.), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">more than one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">several</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very many;</hi> as <pos>adj.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, wholly without <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> force (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9638.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9638.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volcani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres complures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana compluria, Cato ap. Don. l. l.: nova, Ter. Phorm. l. l.: genera, Cic. Fragm. ap. Don. l. l.: scyphorum paria complura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">genera ambiguorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:26:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 26, 111</bibl></cit> (al. plura): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacella publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 51, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9638.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita excellentium virorum complurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9638.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut compluribus tonsoribus operam daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9638.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos complures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 2</bibl>: alios, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 87</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratibus compluribus factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 8, 14 ib. et saep.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">buceta complurima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Hertz.—</sense><sense id="n9638.6" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9638.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">complūres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">several</hi>, <hi rend="ital">many</hi> persons, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecis institutionibus eruditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ea) compluribus narravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata ad complures dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9638.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">complūra</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">many things</hi>: complura ne posui quidem, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem generis complura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
compluriens: <entryFree id="n9639" type="main" key="complu_ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complūrĭens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭes</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>complures</etym>, <sense id="n9639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">several times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">many times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi> (only ante - class.), Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 19</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:15 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 15 sq.</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 65</bibl> (quoted by Gell. and Non. l. l.).</sense></entryFree>
compluscule: <entryFree id="n9640" type="main" key="compluscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compluscŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. complusculi <sense id="n9640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
complusculi: <entryFree id="n9641" type="main" key="compluscu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compluscŭli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n9641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [complures], <hi rend="ital">a good many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">several</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18:22" default="NO">7, 18, 22</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Gell. praef. § 15.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compluscŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pretty often</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complutor: <entryFree id="n9642" type="hapax" key="complu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>compluit, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who gives rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who waters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Div. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Div. 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
complutum: <entryFree id="n9643" type="main" key="Complu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Complūtum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Carpetani in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Alcala de Henarez</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 4, 43.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Complūtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Complutum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Complutensian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 32, 605</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Complūtenses</orth>,<cb n="COMP" />  <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Complutum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compluviatus: <entryFree id="n9644" type="main" key="complu^vi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complŭvĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compluvium, ll.</etym>, <sense id="n9644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fashioned like a</hi> compluvium, i.e. <hi rend="ital">square</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">species jugationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compluvium: <entryFree id="n9645" type="main" key="complu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">complŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>compluit, I.</etym>, <sense id="n9645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quadranguiar open space in the middle of a Roman house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which collected the rain-water flowing from the roofs and conducted it to a basin</hi> (impluvium) <hi rend="ital">placed below</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108, 14</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>; cf. impluvium, II. A.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9645.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a quadrangular support for vines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 14</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 4, 26, 3; cf. compluviatus.</sense></entryFree>
componderans: <entryFree id="n9646" type="main" key="componde^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pondĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pondero</etym>, <sense id="n9646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weighing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari lance,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 89, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compono: <entryFree id="n9647" type="main" key="compo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pōno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>pŏsŭi</itype> (COMPOSEIVERVNT, C. I. L. 1, 199, 2), pŏsĭtum (compostus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 21</bibl> Lorenz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 249</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl>; Varr ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 6</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aggregate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>, etc. (class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n9647.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of different objects. </sense><sense id="n9647.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.3" n="1" level="3"> Of things in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aridum lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositā fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas in tecto in cratibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (loco) erant ea conposita, quibus rex te numerare constituerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amomum) manipulatim leniter componitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras in culleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna in caminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into contact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid... in operibus manu factis tam compositum tamque compactum et coagmentatum inveniri potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>: cum poclo bibo eodem, amplector, labra labellis conpono, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 260, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum latus conponit lateri et cum pectore pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 260, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">conponens manibusque manus atque ori bus ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurio Sais fertur Virgineum conposuisse latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, of broken limbs, etc., med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n9647.5" n="c" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to pack up</hi> for a journey, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia composta sunt quae donavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i ergo intro et compone quae tecum simul Ferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tota domus raedā componitur unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9647.6" n="2" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">is (Saturnus) genus indocile ac dispersum montibus altis Composuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tabula una duos poterit componere amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 22, 13); cf. II. C. 5. infra.—</sense><sense id="n9647.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set in opposition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together in hostility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to couple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">match</hi> in combat (cf. compositio, III.); esp. of gladiators, etc.: Samnis, spurcus homo, cum Pacideiano conponitur, optimus multo Post homines natos gladiator qui fuit unus, Lucil. Sat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 257, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rupili et Persi par pugnat, uti non Compositum melius cum Bitho Bacchius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">staturam habere Threcis cum Threce conpositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4</bibl></cit>, praef. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">and in gen.: si quis casus duos inter se bonos viros composuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuive virūm mallem memet componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:70" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componimur Vecordi Decio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ventis, pelagique furentibus undis Composuit mortale genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 196</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and fig.: pergis pugnantia secum Frontibus adversis componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce par deo dignum, vir fortis cum fortunā malā conpositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illa (rhetorice) secum ipsa componitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of a judicial contest: accita Epicharis et cum indice composita,</quote> <trans><tr>confronted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.9" n="2" level="3"> To oppose by way of comparison, <hi rend="ital">to compare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrast.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: quid est, cur componere ausis mihi te aut me tibi? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 257, 15</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 147 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec divis homines componier aequom'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 141</bibl></cit>: composita dicta evolvunt, Quae cum componas, dicta factis discrepant, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 260, 21</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 48 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">si parva licet conponere magnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvis conponere magna solebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5</bibl>, <pb n="392" /> <cb n="COMP" /> 416: <cit><quote lang="la">audes cladi componere nostrae, Nympha, tuam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:530" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinis humana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Metelli dicta cum factis conposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 1</bibl></cit>: causam suam cum causā adversarii. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n9647.12" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9647.13" n="A" level="2"> Of the parts of a whole, or of a whole as made up of parts. </sense><sense id="n9647.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus ejus conpositus ex variis gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus humanum ex corpore et animā conpositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber ex alienis orationibus compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidoton... ex multis atque interim contrariis quoque inter se effectibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo (umore) componi debet (medicamentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9647.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam gramine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 10" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.18" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of buildings, etc., <hi rend="ital">to construct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cuncta conposuit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Creator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (templa) deis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:708" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 708</bibl></cit> Burm. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aggere conposito tumuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deletas Thebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.19" n="3" level="3"> Of words, <hi rend="ital">to compound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitilitigatores ex vitiis et litigatoribus, Plin. praef. § 32: verba composita (opp. simplicia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9647.20" n="4" level="3"> Of writings, speeches, etc. </sense><sense id="n9647.21" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 966</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compone hoc, quod postulo, de argento: de reliquo videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum eis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum eorum arbitratu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">119: artes,</quote> <trans><tr>books of instruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarium consulatūs mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (litterarum) exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandam disciplinae formulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationum et judiciorum formulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ad religionem deorum immortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:47:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de judicialibus causis aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de ratione dicendi, id. prooem. 1: quae de ortu vitāque Scapulae composita erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apion... inmortalitate donari a se scripsit ad quos aliqua conponebat, Plin. praef. § 25: carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras nomine Marcelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem habere ad conciliandos plebis animos conpositam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditias tremulā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:91" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditata manu verba trementi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollem versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morem annalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra in Gaium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 50: multa et atrocia in Macronem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 44</bibl></cit> (38) et saep.—</sense><sense id="n9647.22" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the subjects, etc., treated, <hi rend="ital">to write about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora Iliaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Troicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juli Africani vitam componendo, spem hominibus fecisti plurium ejus modi librorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres populi Romani res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronis res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; 11, 11.—</sense><sense id="n9647.23" n="B" level="2"> From the notion of closing. </sense><sense id="n9647.24" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamentis conplicandis, conponendis studuimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>folding up the sails and lowering the masts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tempus) ad componenda armamenta expediendumque remigem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela contrahit malosque inclinat et simul armamenta componens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes istos conpone libellos,</quote> <trans><tr>put aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.25" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To store up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec... Aut conponere opes norant aut parcere parto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego conposito securus acervo Despiciam dites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so fig.: condo et compono quae mox depromere possim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.— So esp. <hi rend="ital">to preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put up</hi> fruits, meat, etc., for future use: <cit><quote lang="la">pernas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 162, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergora (suis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: siccatos<cb n="COMP" />  coliculos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepam in fidelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbam ollā novā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 60" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:11:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 11, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus in urceis, capsellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl></cit>, §1.—</sense><sense id="n9647.26" n="3" level="3"> Of the ashes or remains of the dead, <hi rend="ital">to adjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect and inurn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mea conpones et dices, ossa, Properti, Haec tua sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24, 35</bibl></cit> (3, 19, 19): <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:547" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem ossaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:203" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ego conponi versus in ossa velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in gen., of persons, <hi rend="ital">to bury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem... prope cognatos conpositum cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes composui (meos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositi busta avi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:426" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonem Verania uxor... T. Vinium Crispina filia composuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componi tumulo eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro Mortua componar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto Conpositus lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:104" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:95" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.27" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay at rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.28" n="a" level="4"> Of things: omnia noctis erant placidā composta quiete, Varr. Atac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mare compositum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessum tumentes Composuit pelagus ventis patientibus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 702</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.29" n="b" level="4"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vigilantibus, sed etiam quiete compositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam thalamis se conposuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defessa membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene conpositus somno vinoque jacebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.30" n="5" level="3"> To end strife, confusion, etc., <hi rend="ital">to compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconcile</hi>, etc., that which is disturbed or at variance. </sense><sense id="n9647.31" n="a" level="4"> With personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">aversos amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros clementiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia praetorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes concitatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarūm animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:356" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 356</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">prima (pars philosophiae) conponit animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum conpositae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:352" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 352</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio saevas componit mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.32" n="b" level="4"> Of places, countries, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar componendae Armeniae deligitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.33" n="c" level="4"> With abstr. or indef. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">si possum hoc inter vos conponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, inter nos sic haec potius cum bonā Ut componamus gratiā quam cum malā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudens conponi foedere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 109</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 1</bibl>; Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vellet pro communi amico controversias regum componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti per colloquia omnes controversiae componantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:682" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 682</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem civilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum Orientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus Ardeae turbatas seditione res... composuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 53, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum res et bello turbatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Germanicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositis praesentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia et certamina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. transf., with the result as object: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem componi volo Meo patri cum matre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pax cum Carthaginiensibus componi nequisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 40, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at me conpositā pace fefellit Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax circa Brundusium composita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem cum Pyrrho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. D. 2. infra.—</sense><sense id="n9647.34" n="d" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">coheredes mei conponere et transigere cupiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; and so <hi rend="ital">impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam id quod maxime volui fieri non potuit, ut componeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompei summam esse... voluntatem, ut componeretur atque ab armis discederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.35" n="C" level="2"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">to set right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restore to the proper place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adjust</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9647.36" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulaeis se superbis Aureā spondā, of one's attitude on a couch,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ictum militaris gladii conpositā cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diductis aedificia angulis vidimus moveri iterumque conponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:30:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 6, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad rem pertinet, quomodo caelo adfecto conpositisque sideribus quodque animal oriatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi enim gratias agebat, quod signa componenda suscepisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.37" n="2" level="3"> Esp., milit. <cb n="COMP" /> t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad confligendum, Sisenn. ap. Non p. 257, 13: exercitum in hibernaculis, Sali J. 103, 1: in secundā (acie) cohortis, id. H. inc. Fragm. 44 Dietsch: stabant conpositi suis quisque ordinibus (opp. incompositi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpositi numero in turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctos licentiā vagos compositus invadit = compositis ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 89</bibl></cit>; 5, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagos paventesque Vitellianos, sua quemque apud signa, componunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia in numerum legionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 80</bibl></cit> Nipp. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem per turmas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias in montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.38" n="3" level="3"> Of the order of words in language: quam lepide <foreign lang="greek">le/ceis</foreign> compostae! ut tesserulae omnes Arte pavimento atque emblemate vermiculato, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aptior sit oratio, ipsa verba compone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9647.39" n="4" level="3"> With reference to orderly appearance, etc., of the clothing, hair; the expression of the countenance, etc., <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suon quisque loco'st? Vide capillum, satin compositu'st commode?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composito et delibuto capillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne turbarentur comae, quas componi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay in proper folds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen ante adiit... Quam se composuit, quam circumspexit amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinum facili manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 160</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:484" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam libet componere voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu composito, ne laeti excessu principis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberius) compositus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:34" default="NO"
