valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum naturā horridum... efferabat, componens ad speculum in omnem terrorem,</quote> <trans><tr>distorting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.40" n="5" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to adjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>, for the expression of something, or to accord with something; usu. <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad abstinentiam rursus, non secus ac modo ad balineum animum vultumque conposui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis ipsius vultus ad id, quod efficere intendimus, compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrāque manu ad modum aliquid portantium compositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ge. stum oratoris ad similitudinem saltationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuram ad imitationem alterius scripturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ad votum composita civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta ad decorem inperi conposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis ad tristitiam conpositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus conponere famae Taedet,</quote> <trans><tr>to adapt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venturis carbasa ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque mittendis rectum componite telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 717</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero itinera urbis... veste servili in dissimulationem sui compositus pererrabat,</quote> <trans><tr>disguised</tr>, <tr>made up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9647.41" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to a particular form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dispose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9647.42" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego itinera sic composueram, ut Nonis Quinctilibus Puteolis essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adest memento Componere aequus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpositā atque constitutā re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum compositis maturisve satis consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(diem) totum in considerandā causā componendāque posuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in cognoscendis componendisque causis consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sententiā omnibus rebus paratis conpositisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:94:1" default="NO" valid="yes">94, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatu cuncta longis aliorum principatibus composita statim decernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum quae forent firmando Neronis imperio componuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.43" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of the purpose for which, or the example according to which, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alteri placeat auspicia ista ad utilitatem esse rei publicae conposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad voluptatem multitudinis inperitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad omnes casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:321" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 321</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis igitur in hoc nos componet multa scribendi exercitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultum victumque non ad nova exempla conponere, sed ut majorum mores suadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9647.44" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To arrange in agreement with others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspire to make</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9647.45" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: eum allegaverunt, suom qui servom diceret Cum auro esse apud me: conposita est fallacia, <pb n="393" /> <cb n="COMP" /> Ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin jam virginem Despondi: res composita'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita causa componitur, ut item palaestritae Bidini peterent ab Epicrate hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem praedarum cum latronibus conposuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen ab inimicis Romae conpositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:61:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 61, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpositis inter se rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita conposito dolo digrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 111:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 111, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conposito jam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: ceteri proditores ea quae composita erant exspectabant; <cit><quote lang="la">convenerat autem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub noctem susurri Compositā repetantur horā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictum jam foedus, et omnes Conpositae leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositis notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen ac dolum ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 47</bibl>: pacem componere, v. B. 5. supra.—</sense><sense id="n9647.46" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summā concordiā, quos dimitterent, quos retinerent, composuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.47" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, secretis conloquiis conponunt Gallos concire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.48" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut domi compositum cum Marcio erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositum inter ipsos ut Latiaris strueret dolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">P. a. subst.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9647.49" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, in order to deceive or delude, etc.: composita dicta, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 260, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 47 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu istic hodie malo tuo conpositis mendaciis Advenisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bene mendaci risus conponitur ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit> (3, 7, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">sed vobis facile'st verba et conponere fraudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias in me conponis inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 30), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">compositas insidias fatoque evitatas ementitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec fabulosa et composita videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ut augendae famae composita, sic reliqua non in obscuro habentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustatem, ut cetera, in majus conponentem altores Jovis celebravisse,</quote> <trans><tr>exaggerating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">pretending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuming the appearance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Domitianus) paratus simulatione, in adrogantiam compositus audiit preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is in maestitiam compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in securitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc compositus ad maestitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 20</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-postus</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n9647.50" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Well-arranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordered</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (injuria) dum foris sunt, nil videtur mundius, Nec magis compositum quicquam nec magis elegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: admiratus sum ... <foreign lang="greek">su/gxusin</foreign> litterularum, quae solent tuae compositissimae et clarissimae esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior impetu atque animis quam compositior ullo ordine pugna fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegitur, etiamsi non adjecero, conpositum ordinatumque fore talem virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composita et quieta et beata respublica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>. —Of writings: <cit><quote lang="la">quare in his quoque libris erant eadem aliqua... omnia vero compositiora et elaborata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, pr. § 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae curam fatentur et ficta atque composita videri etiam volunt,</quote> <trans><tr>elaborate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, pr. § 23.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the orator himself: <cit><quote lang="la">si aut compositi oratoris bene structam collocationem dissolvas permutatione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.51" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fitly disposed</hi> for any purpose, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qualified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficiam ut nemo umquam paratior, vigilantior, compositior ad judicium venisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">equus bene naturā compositus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 46, 59</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte quādam ab juventā in ostentationem (virtutum) compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alius historiae magis idoneus, alius compositus ad carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeque in adulationem compositus (sacerdos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Attici) non maxime ad risum compositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā atque arte compositus alliciendis etiam Muciani moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.52" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimpassioned</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut peractis quae agenda fuerint salvo jam et composito die possis ibi manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et nitidi et compositi generis amatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>mature</tr>, <tr>sedate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: adfectus mites atque compositi,<cb n="COMP" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium (opp. erectum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitio eorum (civium) labefactabat compositam civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.53" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Compound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made up</hi> of parts (opp. simplex): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO">1, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:5" default="NO">7, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:3" default="NO">2, 12, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭ-tum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is agreed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, etc.; only <case>abl.</case> in the phrases, </sense><sense id="n9647.54" n="(a)" level="5"> Ex composito, <hi rend="ital">according to agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in concert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ex composito orta vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 25, 1</bibl>; 40, 48, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9647.55" n="(b)" level="5"> De composito, <hi rend="ital">by agreement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 1, p. 273</bibl>; and, </sense><sense id="n9647.56" n="(g)" level="5"> More rarely in the same sense, composito alone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 129</bibl>.—Hence also <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in an orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">skilful manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi> (class. but rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Quint.): ambulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composite et apte dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composite, ornate, copiose eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composite atque magnifice casum reipublicae miserati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene et composite disseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositius cuncta quam festinantius agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comportatio: <entryFree id="n9648" type="hapax" key="comporta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comportātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comporto</etym>, <sense id="n9648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comportionalis: <entryFree id="n9649" type="main" key="comporti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-portĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: comportionales termini, <sense id="n9649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the limits between the boundaries of possessions</hi>, Aggen. ap. Goes. p. 51; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:page=254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> p. 254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comporto: <entryFree id="n9650" type="main" key="comporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-porto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nobis opus est rebus exquisitis, undique collectis, arcessitis, comportatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo frumentum ex Asiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum ad mare in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum ex agris in loca tuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma in templum Castoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aggerem caespitibus conportandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum, argentum domum regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptas citharas in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo commeatus e civitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: semper recentes praedas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 613</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compos: <entryFree id="n9651" type="main" key="compo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>pŏtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>potis</etym>, <sense id="n9651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the mastery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">power over a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaking of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sharing in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guilty of</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.); constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, more rarely with <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9651.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: animi, <hi rend="ital">of a sane mind</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">territum et vix mentis suae compotem opprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis compotem mentis... deferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis et consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus doni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicae laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 5</bibl>: voti, <hi rend="ital">having obtained</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gratified one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 486</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 710" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 710</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">votorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9651.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui essent animo et scientiā compotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore atque animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedā ingenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9651.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix compos (sc. mentis) Imilce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:808" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 808</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9651.4" n="B" level="2"> Referring to misfortune or guilt, <hi rend="ital">sharing in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participating in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederate in</hi>, etc. (anteclass. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n9651.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: probri, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 456, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 6 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9651.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: magnis et multis malis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 521, 27</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 36 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n9651.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the thing: <cit><quote lang="la">compote voto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 364" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 364</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
composcens: <entryFree id="n9652" type="main" key="composcens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-poscens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [posco], <sense id="n9652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">demanding at the same time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, p. 136</bibl> Grot. dub. (Kopp, § 425, Deliacos poscens artus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
composite: <entryFree id="n9653" type="main" key="compo^si^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. compono, <sense id="n9653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> <cb n="COMP" /></sense></entryFree>
compositicius: <entryFree id="n9654" type="hapax" key="compo^si^ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compositus</etym>, <sense id="n9654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compound</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compositio: <entryFree id="n9655" type="main" key="compo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compono</etym>. <sense id="n9655.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arranging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjustment</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9655.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 47</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">varia sonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:28:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9655.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., concr., in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a compound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mixture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 17, 16</bibl>. Thus the title of a writing of Scribonius: Compositiones medicae.—</sense><sense id="n9655.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9655.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coherence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">system</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9655.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A drawing up in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris pontificalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9655.6" n="b" level="4"> <foreign lang="greek">*kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a proper connection in style and position of words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota servit gravitati vocum aut suavitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:54:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 54, 182</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 88, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege Ciceronem: conpositio ejus una est, pedem servat lenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:114:15" default="NO">114, 15</bibl>; in Quint. very freq.; cf. the 4th chap. of the 9th book: De compositione.—</sense><sense id="n9655.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A laying together for preservation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a laying up</hi> of fruits, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:26:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:1" default="NO">12, 51, 1</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum auctumnalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9655.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a peaceful union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an accommodation of a difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis, concordiae, compositionis auctor esse non destiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl>; Caes. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13</bibl>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:16:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 16, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9655.9" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bringing together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matching</hi> of combatants: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compositivus: <entryFree id="n9656" type="hapax" key="compo^si^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compositus, compono</etym>, <sense id="n9656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for uniting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compositive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 945</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
composito: <entryFree id="n9657" type="main" key="compo^si^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtō</orth>, <itype>v compono</itype>, <sense id="n9657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compositor: <entryFree id="n9658" type="main" key="compo^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>compono</etym>, <sense id="n9658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maker</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">inventor aut compositor aut actor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit> (al. compositio): <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:356" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae Cumanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=266:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 266, 26</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">melodiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
compositura: <entryFree id="n9659" type="main" key="compo^si^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtūra</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">compostūra</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 3</bibl>). <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi> (very rare, and only anteclass.). </sense><sense id="n9659.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">olei, Cato, l. l.: oculorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a connection</tr>, <tr>commissure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 327</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9659.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">conneclion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syntax</hi>: partium orationis, Sinn. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compositus: <entryFree id="n9660" type="main" key="compo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from compono.</entryFree>
compossessor: <entryFree id="n9661" type="hapax" key="compossessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-possessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jointpossessor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compostura: <entryFree id="n9662" type="main" key="compostu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compostūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. compositura.</entryFree>
compostus: <entryFree id="n9663" type="main" key="compostus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compostus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. compono <sense id="n9663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compotatio: <entryFree id="n9664" type="main" key="compo_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pōtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking together</hi>, as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sumpo/sion</foreign> (perh. only in Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compotator: <entryFree id="n9665" type="main" key="compo_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compōtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, collat. form of compotor, <sense id="n9665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-companion</hi> (late Lat.), Ambros. de Job et Dav. 3, 5, 17.</sense></entryFree>
compotens: <entryFree id="n9666" type="gloss" key="compo^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having power with one</hi>, an epithet of Diana, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 41, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compotio: <entryFree id="n9667" type="main" key="compo^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŏtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>compos</etym>, <sense id="n9667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make partaker of</hi> (only anteand post- class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen. rei.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9667.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me piscatu novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praedae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. prol. p. 366, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem voti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9667.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become partaker of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become master of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">to come into;</hi> cf. the same, v. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem hunc potiri): visu, auditu ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compotor: <entryFree id="n9668" type="main" key="compo_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pōtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot-companion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compotrix: <entryFree id="n9669" type="main" key="compo_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pōtrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compotor</etym>, <sense id="n9669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female drinking - companion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compraecido: <entryFree id="n9670" type="hapax" key="compraeci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-praecīdo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off at the same time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteram lineam (altera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. p. 177" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. p. 177</bibl></cit> Goes. dub. <pb n="394" /> <cb n="COMP" /></sense></entryFree>
compraes: <entryFree id="n9671" type="gloss" key="compraes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-praes</orth>, <itype>praedis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint-surety</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 10</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
compransor: <entryFree id="n9672" type="main" key="compransor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pransor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion in a banquet, a boon companion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comprecatio: <entryFree id="n9673" type="main" key="compre^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comprecor</etym>, <sense id="n9673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">public imploring of a deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollennis deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm inmortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comprecor: <entryFree id="n9674" type="main" key="compre^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prĕcor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ātus, āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (lit. to worship a deity with all the usages belonging thereto; hence, in gen.), <sense id="n9674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pray to, supplicate, implore</hi> (mostly ante-class. and rare; not in Cic.); constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui, aliquem, aliquid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi molā salsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 65</bibl></cit> and 70: caelestūm fidem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 191</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Absol., to pray, supplicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi intro et conprecare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cythereïa, comprecor, ausis Assit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 640</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 379</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case> of <hi rend="ital">pers., to imprecate, wish</hi> for a person: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc mortem comprecantur sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum principem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
comprehendo: <entryFree id="n9675" type="main" key="compre^hendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prĕhendo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prendo</orth>, very freq. in MSS. and edd.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl>. In MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">comprae-hendo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">compraendo</orth>, v. prehendo), di, sum, 3, <sense id="n9675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lay hold of something on all sides; to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catch hold of, seize, grasp, apprehend; to comprehend, comprise</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9675.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9675.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid (opus est) manibus, si nihil comprehendendum est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vulva) non multo major quam ut manu comprehendatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (forfex) dentem comprehendere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordicus manum eorum (elephantorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsu guttura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces modio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to join one to another, fasten together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oras vulneris suturae comprehendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehendunt utrumque et orant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter frustra comprensa manus effugit imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 794</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:92" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quae validissima (ovis), non comprehendatur (sc. stabulis) hieme,</quote> <trans><tr>let none but the strongest be kept in the winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl></cit> Schneid.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in flumine Vulturno comprehensae,</quote> <trans><tr>assembled together, put under an embargo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take, catch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a reverse constr.: ignis robora comprendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 305</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opera flammā comprehensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">avidis comprenditur ignibus agger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensa aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9675.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To attack, seize upon in a hostile manner, to seize, lay hold of, arrest, catch, apprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pro moecho Comprehendere et constringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam capitalem hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarios duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Virginium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium Punicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc comprehenderant atque in vincula conjecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fugā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of disease: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensus morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensi pestiferā lue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 32, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of places, <hi rend="ital">to occupy, seize upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis comprehensis collibus munitiones perfecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—*</sense><sense id="n9675.5" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to intercept'</hi>-epistulas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seize upon one, to apprehend him in any crime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 35</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: qui interesse concentibus interdictis fuerint comprehensi, Cod. Th. 16, 4, 5.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9675.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the crime: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandum adulterium,</quote> <trans><tr>to discover, detect it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ejus indicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.8" n="3" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to take root;</hi> of a graft: <cit><quote lang="la">cum comprehendit (surculus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:18" default="NO">5, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 13, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.9" n="4" level="3"> Of women, <hi rend="ital">to conceive, become pregnant</hi>, = concipere: <cit><quote lang="la">si mulier non comprehendit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9675.10" n="5" level="3"> Of a space, <hi rend="ital">to contain, comprise, comprehend, include</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nuces integras, quas uno modio comprehendere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuitus ejus triginta et duo stadia comprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9675.11" n="6" level="3"> In late medic. lang., of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to combine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid melle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 6, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 88" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:227 al" default="NO">227 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9675.12" n="7" level="3"> Of the range <cb n="COMP" /> of a missile: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum impulsa valet comprehendere lancea nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:102" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.13" n="8" level="3"> Of the reach of a surgical instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">si vitium in angusto est, quod comprehendere modiolus possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9675.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9675.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend by the sense of sight, to perceive, observe, see</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:408" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 408</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without visu: comprehendere vix litterarum apices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend something intellectually, to receive into one's mind, to grasp, perceive, comprehend;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: si quam opinionem jam mentibus vestris comprehendistis: si eam ratio convellet, si oratio labefactabit, etc., <hi rend="ital">if any opinion has already taken root in your mind</hi> (the figure taken from the rooting of plants; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. B. 3.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes animo virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo haec tenemus comprehensa, non sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia animis et cogitatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:31:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 31, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis animus sit vacans corpore, intellegere et cogitatione comprehendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid certis signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid experimentis assiduis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquid, quod conprehendi et percipi posset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum cognitio confirmat percipi et conprehendi multa posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; 1, 11, 42.—</sense><sense id="n9675.17" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">include</hi> in words; <hi rend="ital">to comprise in discourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in writing, to express, describe, recount, narrate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter paucis comprendere multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1082</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter comprehensa sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehendam brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde ac si in hanc formulam omnia judicia conclusa et comprehensa sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) verbis luculentioribus et pluribus rem eandem comprehenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa natura circumscriptione quādam verborum comprehendit concluditque sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā (terrā) enim et lapis et harena et cetera ejus generis sunt in nominando comprehensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastra quoque, quae supra comprehensa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad veterum rerum nostrarum memoriam comprehendendam impulsi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si comprendere coner,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9675.18" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: aliquid numero, <hi rend="ital">to number, enumerate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim numero comprendere refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 447</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum quorum comprendere non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 11, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9675.19" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To comprehend any one in affection, to bind to one's self, to put under obligation, to embrace with kindness</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly in Cic.): multos amicitiā, tueri obsequio, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to have many friends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentem humanitate tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnibus officiis per se, per patrem, per majores suos totam Atinatem praefecturam comprehenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19</bibl></cit>. 47.— </sense><sense id="n9675.20" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shut in, include</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum in effigiem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementorum figurae humanā specie comprehensae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n9676" type="main" key="compre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕhensĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n9676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be seized</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laid hold of</hi> (very rare; prob. first used by Cic.). </sense><sense id="n9676.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensibile et solidum corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕ-hensĭbĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (opp. incomprehensibile), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9676.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> *</sense><sense id="n9676.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Perceptible by the senses, evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensibilia oculis foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9676.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Perceptible to the mind, conceivable, intelligible</hi>: id autem visum, cum ipsum per se cerneretur, comprehensibile, feretis haec? Nos vero, inquit, quonam enim modo <foreign lang="greek">katalhpto/n</foreign> diceres? etc., * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura non comprehensibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl></cit> pr. § <cit><quote lang="la">46: causae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comprehensio: <entryFree id="n9677" type="main" key="compre^hensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕhensĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seizing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laying hold of with the hands</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9677.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9677.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus, cursus, sessio, comprehensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9677.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a hostile seizure, arresting, catching, apprehending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9677.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9677.5" n="A" level="2"> In philos. lang., of <hi rend="ital">a mental comprehending, perceiving;</hi> and in concr., <hi rend="ital">a comprehension, perception, idea</hi>, transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">katalhyis</foreign>: mens amplectitur maxime<cb n="COMP" />  cognitionem et istam <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyin</foreign>, quam, ut dixi, verbum e verbo exprimentes comprehensionem dicemus, cum ipsam per se amat, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 41</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes comprehensionesque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9677.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The power to unite and grasp as a whole things which belong together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta ... consequentium rerum cum primis conjunctio et comprehensio esset in nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 147</bibl></cit> Schoem. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n9677.7" n="B" level="2"> In rhet. </sense><sense id="n9677.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Expression, style</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:198" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 58, 198</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9677.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut comprehensio numerose et apte cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 140</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:115:121" default="NO">9, 115, 121</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
comprehensivus: <entryFree id="n9678" type="main" key="compre^hensi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕhensīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n9678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comprehensible, conceivable</hi> (late Lat.): definitione, Boëth. Defin. p. 660.</sense></entryFree>
comprehenso: <entryFree id="n9679" type="hapax" key="compre^henso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕhenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi>: suos, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
comprehensus: <entryFree id="n9680" type="main" key="compre^hensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprĕhensus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">comprensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from comprehendo.</entryFree>
comprendo: <entryFree id="n9681" type="main" key="comprendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. comprehendo.</entryFree>
compresbyter: <entryFree id="n9682" type="main" key="compresby^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-presbyter</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellowpresbyter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 228" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compresse: <entryFree id="n9683" type="main" key="compresse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compressē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>; v. comprimo, <sense id="n9683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compressio: <entryFree id="n9684" type="main" key="compressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compressĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>com primo</etym>, <sense id="n9684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing together, compression</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9684.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9684.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum compressione coactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 6</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9684.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n9684.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An embracing</hi>: artae amantūm, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 64</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9684.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Copulation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 187" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9684.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of diction, <hi rend="ital">the compression of an expression</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 29</bibl>; v. Ellendt. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n9684.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A suppression, repression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum civilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporalium cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 48</bibl></cit>, Serm. 19, § 19.</sense></entryFree>
compresso: <entryFree id="n9685" type="main" key="compresso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compresso</orth>, no <sense id="n9685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to press, oppress</hi> (late Lat.), Tert. contr. Gnost. 3; Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compressor: <entryFree id="n9686" type="main" key="compressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compressor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who compresses</hi> (in mal. part.), Mythogr. Vatic. 1, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Argum. Aul. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compressus: <entryFree id="n9687" type="main" key="compressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from comprimo.</entryFree>
