<entryFree id="n9688" type="main" key="compressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comprimo</etym>, <sense id="n9688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing together, compression</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n9688.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: semen tepefactum vapore et compressu suo diffindit (terra), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9688.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an embracing, copulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comprimo: <entryFree id="n9689" type="main" key="compri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n9689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squeeze together, compress</hi> (very freq and class.). </sense><sense id="n9689.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpora) inter se compressa teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plane (digitos) compresserat pugnumque fecerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">compressa in pugnum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:104" default="NO">11, 3, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oculos) opertos compressosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressā palmā,</quote> <trans><tr>with the clinched hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressam forcipe lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 556</bibl></cit>: labra, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam compressa manu sit (terra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus dorsum boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines (aciei),</quote> <trans><tr>to make more dense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus ordinibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to write closely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <trans><tr>to lie with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 2 al.</bibl>—Hence the equivocation in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 29 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 6</bibl>.—Also of the treading of a peacock, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 5</bibl>.— Prov.: compressis manibus sedere, <hi rend="ital">with the hands folded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be unemployed, at leisure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">compressas tenuisse manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 292</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9689.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. with the access. idea of restraining free motion. </sense><sense id="n9689.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold back, hold, keep in, restrain;</hi> prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold one's breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to silence him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 192</bibl></cit>; cf. I. supra, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam (opp. inmittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to check a diarrhœa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 7</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind, make costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and transf. to the person: si morbus<pb n="395" /> <cb n="COMP" />  aliquem compresserit, id. praef.—</sense><sense id="n9689.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9689.5" n="1" level="3"> Of passions, dispositions, intentions, actions, etc., <hi rend="ital">to restrain, hinder, check, repress, curb</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">vocem et orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprimere atque restinguere incensam illius cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatum atque audaciam furentis hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodii conatus furoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor compressus edendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicios furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocitatem tuam istam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi temere excitati tumultus sunt compressique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultantem laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce manuque Murmura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 54</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n9689.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te conprimere possum sine malo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac sedare exasperatos Ligures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 45, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus adventus Pompeianos compressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprime te, nimium tinnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix comprimor, quin involem illi in oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9689.7" n="C" level="2"> With the access. idea of withholding evidence or knowledge ( = supprimo), <hi rend="ital">to keep to one's self, keep back, withhold, suppress, conceal</hi> (rare, but in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Cic.): frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa, magna delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem illam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam captae Carthaginis ex industriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">compressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., pressed together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">close, strait, narrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculus oris compressioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:80" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 11, 16, § 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9689.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Costive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: morbi, <hi rend="ital">connected with costiveness</hi>, id. praef.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">compressē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n9689.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In a compressed manner, briefly, succinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressius loqui (opp. latius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9689.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pressingly, urgently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressius violentiusque quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comprobatio: <entryFree id="n9690" type="hapax" key="compro^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprŏbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comprobo</etym>, <sense id="n9690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">approbation, approval</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comprobator: <entryFree id="n9691" type="hapax" key="compro^ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprŏbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an approver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 28, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comprobo: <entryFree id="n9692" type="main" key="compro^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prŏbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n9692.0" n="I" level="1"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">to approve wholly of something, to assent to, sanction, acknowledge</hi> (class and very freq., esp in prose): <cit><quote lang="la">istam tuam sentent. am laudo vehementissimeque comprobo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, D, 14 sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem omnium assensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensu potius eruditorum quam puerorum amore comprobari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 130</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">has comproba tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne domesticis quidem exemplis docti numen deorum comprobabimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9692.1" n="II" level="1"> Object., <hi rend="ital">to prove, establish, attest, make good, show, confirm, verify something</hi> to others as true, good, excellent, virtuous, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut beneficium verbis initum nunc re comprobes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hoc oratione solum, sed multo magis vita et factis et moribus conprobavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris dictum sapiens temeritas filii comprobavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 63, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprobat hominis consilium fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem alicujus testimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indicio conprobato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perceleri (servi) interitu esse ab hoc comprobatum venenum,</quote> <trans><tr>the quality of the poison was tested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compromissarius: <entryFree id="n9693" type="main" key="compro_missa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprōmissārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>compromissum</etym>, <sense id="n9693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to arbitration</hi>: judex, <hi rend="ital">an arbitrator, umpire, referee chosen by contending parties</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:5:4" default="NO">26, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compromissum: <entryFree id="n9694" type="main" key="compro_missum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comprōmissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mutual promise to abide by the award of an arbiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 1 sq.</bibl>—From</sense></entryFree>
compromitto: <entryFree id="n9695" type="main" key="compro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prōmitto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype> (contr. form conpromesise = conpromisisse, S. C. Bacch. v. 14), <pos>v. a.</pos>, jurid. t. t. in lawsuits, <sense id="n9695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to promise mutually to abide by the decision of an arbiter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicii candidati conpromiserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14</bibl></cit> <cb n="COMP" /> (15, 6): <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arbitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:21 al" default="NO">4, 8, 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9695.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To promise at the same time</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eisque spolia peremptorum hostium compromittens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comprovincialis: <entryFree id="n9696" type="hapax" key="compro_vinci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-prōvincĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n9696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., born in the same province</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compsa: <entryFree id="n9697" type="main" key="Compsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Compsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Hirpini in Samnium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Conza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Compsānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cons-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Compsa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61</bibl>, §§ 160 and 164.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Compsāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cons-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Compsa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compte: <entryFree id="n9698" type="main" key="compte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. como, <sense id="n9698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comptionalis: <entryFree id="n9699" type="main" key="compti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptĭōnālis</orth>, v. coemptionalis.</entryFree>
comptor: <entryFree id="n9700" type="main" key="comptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. como</etym>, <sense id="n9700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who adorns;</hi> only trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comptulus: <entryFree id="n9701" type="hapax" key="comptu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n9701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [comptus, 1. como], <hi rend="ital">luxuriously decked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 128</bibl></cit>, n. 4.</sense></entryFree>
comptus: <entryFree id="n9702" type="main" key="comptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. <itype>como</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9703" type="hapax" key="comptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coëmo = conjungo; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1061</bibl>; Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 950</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n9703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band, tie</hi> ( = coëmptio): <cit><quote lang="la">qui comptu conjugioque Corporis atque animae consistimus pariter apti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 845</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9704" type="main" key="comptus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. como</etym>, <sense id="n9704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament for the hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">head, a head-dress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 88</bibl>; Afran. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=40:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 40, 9</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 63, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compugnantia: <entryFree id="n9705" type="main" key="compugnanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compugnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compugno</etym>, <sense id="n9705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fighting together</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter se contrariorum aërum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 35, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compugno: <entryFree id="n9706" type="main" key="compugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pugno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n9706.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contend together</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:4" default="NO">14, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5" default="NO">14, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. de Vita S. Mart. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9706.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To combat together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaritudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compulsamentum: <entryFree id="n9707" type="main" key="compulsa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulsāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>compulso</etym>, <sense id="n9707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an impelling;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an exhortation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compulsatio: <entryFree id="n9708" type="main" key="compulsa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (hostile) <hi rend="ital">pressing together, a contest, contention</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; Fulg. Myth. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
compulsio: <entryFree id="n9709" type="main" key="compulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compello</etym>. <sense id="n9709.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An urging, constraint, compulsion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:14:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 14, § 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n9709.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dunning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compulso: <entryFree id="n9710" type="main" key="compulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n9710.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strike violently</hi> (post-class. and rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9710.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To contend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fight together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 20</bibl>; cf. compulsatio.</sense></entryFree>
compulsor: <entryFree id="n9711" type="main" key="compulsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n9711.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a driver</hi> (of cattle), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 2, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9711.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who asks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forces to a payment, an exacter of money</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 6, 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 10, 3 and 4; 11, 7, 15.</sense></entryFree>
compulsus: <entryFree id="n9712" type="main" key="compulsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from compello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9713" type="hapax" key="compulsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compulsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>compello</etym>, <sense id="n9713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (hostile) <hi rend="ital">striking together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 203, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compulteria: <entryFree id="n9714" type="main" key="Compulteri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Compulterĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little town in Samnium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39:6:24:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39, 6, 24, 20, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
compunctio: <entryFree id="n9715" type="main" key="compuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>compungo</etym>. <sense id="n9715.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a puncture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 3, § 8.—</sense><sense id="n9715.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sting of conscience, remorse</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 4, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
compunctorius: <entryFree id="n9716" type="main" key="compuncto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compunctōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">admonitory, hortatory</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
compunctus: <entryFree id="n9717" type="main" key="compunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from compungo.</entryFree>
compungo: <entryFree id="n9718" type="main" key="compungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pungo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to prick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puncture severely, to sting</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9718.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">collum dolone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeis urticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarus compunctus notis Threïciis,</quote> <trans><tr>branded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(colores) qui compungunt aciem lacrumareque cogunt,</quote> <trans><tr>dazzle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 420</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of heat and cold: sensus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 432</bibl></cit> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 39</bibl>, v. compingo).—</sense><sense id="n9718.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9718.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(dialectici) ipsi se compungunt suis acuminibus,</quote> <trans><tr>prick themselves with their own stings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9718.4" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat. compungi, <hi rend="ital">to be goaded by the stings of conscience, to feel remorse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 13</bibl>; cf. compunctio.</sense></entryFree>
compurgatio: <entryFree id="n9719" type="main" key="compurga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compurgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complete purification</hi><cb n="CONA" />  (late Lat.): tres compurgationes, i. e. by fire, air, and water, Mythogr. Lat. 3, 6, 18.</sense></entryFree>
compurgo: <entryFree id="n9720" type="hapax" key="compurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-purgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to purify completely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
computabilis: <entryFree id="n9721" type="hapax" key="compu^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>computo</etym>, <sense id="n9721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be computed, computable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
computatio: <entryFree id="n9722" type="main" key="compu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a computing, reckoning; a computation</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n9722.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:206" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 33, 38, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38, 3</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:35 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 35 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9722.2" n="II" level="1"> Specif., the reckoning of avaricious men, <hi rend="ital">close reckoning, niggardliness, parsimony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
computator: <entryFree id="n9723" type="main" key="compu^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a computer, reckoner</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">diligentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:5 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 5 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
computo: <entryFree id="n9724" type="main" key="compu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pŭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n9724.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sum up, reckon, compute.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9724.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">id si computare quem piget, brevioribus numeris idem discat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos, quibus viximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:249" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 249</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurna tantum tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudinem Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 33, 38, § 209</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9724.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">computare quantum Curius aut Fabricius in triumphis tulerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">computare quid studia referant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9724.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: praesens computarat, pecuniam imperarat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoris mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9724.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: valetudinem cum somno, Plin. praef. § 18.—</sense><sense id="n9724.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies tua computat annos,</quote> <trans><tr>shows, reveals thy age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures conputant quam oderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have an eye to their interests, rather than to their hatred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9724.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon in with</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi> (in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fetus pecorum fructibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
computresco: <entryFree id="n9725" type="main" key="compu_^tresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-pū^tresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>), <itype>trŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become wholly putrid, to putrefy, rot</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.): Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 23, § 67</bibl> (Sillig, conputuere).—Per tmesin: <cit><quote lang="la">artus pereunt conque putrescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
computus: <entryFree id="n9726" type="main" key="compu^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">compŭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>computo</etym>, <sense id="n9726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a computation</hi> (late Lat.), Firm. Math. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Auct. ap. Goes. <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 236</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comte: <entryFree id="n9727" type="main" key="comte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comtē</orth> = compte, v. 1. como, <sense id="n9727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comtulus: <entryFree id="n9728" type="main" key="comtu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. comptulus.</entryFree>
comtus: <entryFree id="n9729" type="main" key="comtus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = comptus, a, um, v. 1. <itype>como</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9730" type="main" key="comtus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. 2. comptus.</entryFree>
comula: <entryFree id="n9731" type="hapax" key="co^mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>coma</etym>, <sense id="n9731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pretty hair</hi> bessalis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 60, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comum: <entryFree id="n9732" type="main" key="Co_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kw=mon</foreign>, <sense id="n9732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a considerable town in</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the younger Pliny</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Como</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; rebuilt by Caesar; hence also called Novum Comum (<foreign lang="greek">*neo/kwmon</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9732.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Comum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Comensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 232</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Comum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36, 9</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 37, 10</bibl>; and, acc. to the later ap pel., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvŏcōmensis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 35, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
con: <entryFree id="n9733" type="main" key="con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con</orth>, v 1. cum <sense id="n9733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conabilis: <entryFree id="n9734" type="main" key="co_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conor</etym>, <sense id="n9734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laborious, difficult</hi> (late Lat.): conabiles atque laboriosi vomitus, Cael. Aur Acut. 3, 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
conamen: <entryFree id="n9735" type="main" key="co_na_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an effort, exertion, struggle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno conamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:366" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 287</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">conamina mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 390</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1040" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1040</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9735.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a support, prop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit (infans), adjutis aliquo conamine nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 224</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conamentum: <entryFree id="n9736" type="hapax" key="co_na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>conamen</etym>, <sense id="n9736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for uprooting a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 7, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conatio: <entryFree id="n9737" type="main" key="co_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conor</etym>, <sense id="n9737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an undertaking, endeavoring, an effort, endeavor, attempt</hi> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conatum: <entryFree id="n9738" type="main" key="co_na_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, usu. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. conor.</entryFree>
conatus: <entryFree id="n9739" type="main" key="co_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conor</etym>. <sense id="n9739.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">an effort, exertion, struggle, endeavor</hi>: ue <pb n="396" /> <cb n="CONC" /> ista hercle magno jam conatu magnas nugas dixerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo majore conatu studioque aguntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem sui tribunatus conatum in meam perniciem parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Genucius ad hostes magno conatu profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso conatu rerum circumegit se annus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>just as the affair was well begun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 18, 15</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum inchoatis rebus in ipso conatu gerendi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9739.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an impulse, inclination, tendency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedit natura beluis et sensum et appetitum, ut altero conatum haberent ad naturales pastus capessendos, altero secernerent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est ullo in genere laus orationis, cujus in nostris orationibus non sit aliqua si non perfectio, at conatus tamen atque adumbratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad hostes contulit conatumque iracundiae suae morte sedavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 10, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9739.2" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an attempt, effort, undertaking, enterprise, endeavor</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9739.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii, si perrumpere possent conati ... telis repulsi hoc conatu destiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principem esse ad conatum exercitus conparandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac ego religione non sum ab hoc conatu repulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in me impetum facere conabitur ... ejus conatum refutabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Icarus primo statim conatu decidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a conatu resistendi deterritus se dedidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9739.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressi tuos nefarios conatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod conatus adversariorum infregissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B, G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut opprimet hominem aut omnis ejus motus conatusque prohibebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis frustra conatibus captis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 29, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatibus alicujus accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediis conatibus aegri Succidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:910" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 910</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstare conatibus nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 683</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 9; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">optimi et clarissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebri parvique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentes adversus Germaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vibrare nudis conatibus hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:161" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatus alicujus supra vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conauditum: <entryFree id="n9740" type="gloss" key="co^naudi_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏnaudītum</orth> <itype>coauditum, sicut conangustatum dicitur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
concaco: <entryFree id="n9741" type="main" key="conca^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-căco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to defile with ordure, to fill with defilement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catillus concacatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concaedes: <entryFree id="n9742" type="main" key="concaedes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-caedes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (<sense id="n9742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. abl.</hi> concaede, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 15</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an abattis, barricade of felled trees</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 10, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concalefacio: <entryFree id="n9743" type="main" key="conca^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-călĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to warm thoroughly</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9743.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 316</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9743.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">concălĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, factus sum: <cit><quote lang="la">vertat ova, uti aequabiliter concalefiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes concalefaciuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are heated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit> (cf. calefacientur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 10</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">(concursio corporum) concalefacta et spirabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit> (but in Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 92, 22</bibl>, the read. is dub.).</sense></entryFree>
concalefactorius: <entryFree id="n9744" type="main" key="conca^le^facto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concălĕfactōrĭus</orth>, v. concalfactorius.</entryFree>
concalefactus: <entryFree id="n9745" type="main" key="conca^le^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concălĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. concalefacio.</entryFree>
concalefio: <entryFree id="n9746" type="main" key="conca^le^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concălĕfīo</orth>, v. concalefacio.</entryFree>
concaleo: <entryFree id="n9747" type="main" key="conca^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-călĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <sense id="n9747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be thoroughly warm</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concalesco: <entryFree id="n9748" type="main" key="conca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-călesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow thoroughly warm, to glow</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9748.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare but class.): corpora nostra ardore animi concalescunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta non poterunt cito concalescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 304</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 17</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:50" default="NO">2, 50</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9748.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glow with love</hi>: concaluit, quid vis? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 108</bibl> Don.</sense></entryFree>
concalfactorius: <entryFree id="n9749" type="main" key="concalfacto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-calfactōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concalefacio</etym>, <sense id="n9749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for warming, warming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concallesco: <entryFree id="n9750" type="main" key="concallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-callesco</orth>, <itype>callui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [calleo]; lit., <hi rend="ital">to become hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">callous;</hi> hence, trop., * </sense><sense id="n9750.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the intellect, <hi rend="ital">to become shrewd, practised</hi> (cf. calleo, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">callidos eos appello, quorum, tamquam manus opere, sic animus usu concalluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9750.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the feelings, <hi rend="ital">to become insensible, obtuse</hi>: <cb n="CONC" /> locus ille animi nostri, stomachus ubi habitabat olim, concalluit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concameratio: <entryFree id="n9751" type="main" key="conca^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concămĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concamero</etym>, <sense id="n9751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vaulting; a vault</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:31 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
concamero: <entryFree id="n9752" type="main" key="conca^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cămĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to vault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arch over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 42, § 148</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3033</bibl>: uvae pensili concameratae nodo, <hi rend="ital">suspended from a vault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concandesco: <entryFree id="n9753" type="hapax" key="concandesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-candesco</orth>, <itype>candui, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to glow, be inflamed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 874</bibl> ex conj. (Codd. excanduit).</sense></entryFree>
concani: <entryFree id="n9754" type="main" key="Conca^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Concăni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kwgkanoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n9754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a savage people of Cantabria in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis; <number>sing.</number> collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">Concanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:361" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 361</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concapit: <entryFree id="n9755" type="gloss" key="concapit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concapit</orth>, <itype>a corrupt word</itype>, and difficult of explanation; in the XII. Tab. in a passage in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=365" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 365</bibl> Müll.; cf. Dirks. Uebersicht, etc., p. 433 sq.</entryFree>
concaptivus: <entryFree id="n9756" type="main" key="concapti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-captīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-captive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 16, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concarnatio: <entryFree id="n9757" type="main" key="concarna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concarnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concarno</etym>, <sense id="n9757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a uniting with flesh, incarnation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mon. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
concarno: <entryFree id="n9758" type="main" key="concarno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-carno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unite</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clothe with flesh, to incarnate</hi> (post-class. and very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Christ. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concastigo: <entryFree id="n9759" type="main" key="concasti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-castīgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to chastise severely, to punish</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concatenatio: <entryFree id="n9760" type="main" key="conca^te_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concătēnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concateno</etym>, <sense id="n9760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connecting, joining</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n9760.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9760.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9760.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A concatenation, sequence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit>: causarum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 30.—</sense><sense id="n9760.4" n="b" level="4"> Mentis (i. e. constrictio), <hi rend="ital">fettering, binding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concateno: <entryFree id="n9761" type="main" key="conca^te_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cătēno</orth>, no <sense id="n9761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to link</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind together, to connect</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concatervatus: <entryFree id="n9762" type="main" key="conca^terva_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cătervātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caterva</etym>, <sense id="n9762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowded together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concavitas: <entryFree id="n9763" type="main" key="conca^vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concăvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concavus</etym>, <sense id="n9763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow, cavity</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concavo: <entryFree id="n9764" type="main" key="conca^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concăvo</orth>, no <sense id="n9764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make hollow, to hollow out, make round</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia in arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>to curve, bend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 195</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concavati nidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concavus: <entryFree id="n9765" type="main" key="conca^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-căvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n9765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., hollow, concave; arched, vaulted; bent, curved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 619</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concava aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudines speluncarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia Cancri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 127</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 369: jugula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (opp. plana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>swelling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:276" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 238" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 238</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9765.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-căva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">hollow places, hollows</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concedo: <entryFree id="n9766" type="main" key="conce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n9766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (a strengthened cedo, and corresp. with it in most of its signiff.); lit., <hi rend="ital">to go, walk;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n9766.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, with reference to the terminus a quo, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">walk away</hi> from a place, <hi rend="ital">to depart, retire, withdraw, remove from</hi> (in lit. signif. rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9766.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">concedite atque abscedite omnes, de viā decedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae concedite silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>farewell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 63</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">a foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oculis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superis ab oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:628" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 628</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9766.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn. ( = cedo, II. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to pass away, disappear, vanish</hi>, in Tac. (with and without vitā), <hi rend="ital">to depart from life, die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumor et irae Concessere deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <trans><tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 39</bibl>; 12, 39; 14, 51; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: quandoque concessero,<cb n="CONC" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38</bibl>; 13, 30; <cit><quote lang="la">the same: concessit superis ab oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā per auras concessit ad Manes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 820</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9766.5" n="2" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, prop. qs. <hi rend="ital">to go out of the way for one</hi> (on account of his wishes, or his superior power or excellence), i. e. <hi rend="ital">to yield to, submit, give way to, adapt one's self to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9766.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To yield</hi> or <hi rend="ital">submit to power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compulsion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut magnitudini medicinae doloris magnitudo concederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:29:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 29, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est, concedere homini nato nemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nox quoquam concedit die (i. e. diei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 48</bibl>): cedant arma togae, concedat laurea linguae, Cic. Poët. Off. 1, 22, 77 (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 74</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 24</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ac tumultum paci atque otio concessurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Pis. 30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem concessuram dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Fin. 3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidioni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>permit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operi meo concedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 393</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:11:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis magnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:554" default="NO"><author>Val.
