Fl.</author> 1, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparebat aut hostibus aut civibus de victoriā concedendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. so <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam concessum propemodum de victoriā credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 60, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To give place to in excellence, dignity, rank</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to yield to, to give precedence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me amantissimum tui, nemini concedentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 3, 4: etsi de cupiditate nemini concedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese unis Suebis concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestati ejus viri concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 17</bibl>; cf. so <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla, cujus facundiae, non aetati a Manlio concessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 102, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigenti Silio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seniori Sentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix Apronio illi de familiaritate concedere videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antario Varoque de gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemini in illa causā studio et cupiditate concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amore in hanc patriam nobis concedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, si muneribus certes, concedat Iollas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of quantity (cf. 3. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">magistro tantulum de arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui quicquam in desperatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 18, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9766.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To yield, submit to one's will, comply with one's wishes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi concedam, neque tuae libidini advorsabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matri meae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessit senatus postulationi tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisconsultis concedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 67</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ... concedendum non putabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.9" n="d" level="4"> Like <foreign lang="greek">sugxwrei=n tini</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to assent to, concede to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunquamne hodie concedes mihi Neque intelleges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 22</bibl></cit> (credes, consenties, Ruhnk.): <cit><quote lang="la">stultum me fateor, liceat concedere veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 305</bibl></cit> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sugxwrei=n th=| a)lhqei/a|</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n9766.10" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To assent to, grant, pardon, allow</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (judices) alienis peccatis concessuros putes, quo facilius ipsis peccare liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:96:section=223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 96, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae non ignoscit, nobis concedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto concedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (vitio) si concedere nolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 140</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 85</bibl>.—Hence (cf. cedo, II. A. 3. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), </sense><sense id="n9766.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> (and <case>dat.</case>) aliquid alicui. </sense><sense id="n9766.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To grant, concede, allow; to consign something over to, to resign, yield, vouchsafe, confirm to</hi>, etc. (very freq. in all perr. and species of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">illum mihi aequius est quam me illi quae volo concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nunc de tuo jure concessisses paululum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem octavam pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">date hoc et concedite pudori meo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui primas in dicendo partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicis quicquid velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quicquam illius audaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 35, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artes tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegentiam, prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principatum imperii maritimi Atheniensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Dion, 6, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 15, 37; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus quieti, aut luxuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestivum pueris ludum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>: crimen gratiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inform against for the sake of favor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to pardon him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: Siciliam nimis celeri desperatione rerum concessam,<pb n="397" /> <cb n="CONC" />  <hi rend="ital">had been ceded, given up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaevolae concessa est facundiae virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO">10, 1, 100</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius ... Ulcisci, quam nunc concessum est legibus aequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1148</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessit in iras Ipse ... genitor Calydona Dianae,</quote> <trans><tr>gave over to be punished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 305</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nostrā dicere linguā Concedit nobis patrii sermonis egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 831</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ducere neptem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse poëtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 373</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā nisi per concilium loqui non conceditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mihi fortunam, si non conceditur uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:42" default="NO">12, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:76" default="NO">8, 6, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servis quoque pueros hujus aetatis verberare concedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedunt plangere matri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:134" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum accusare etiam palam concessum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:27" default="NO">2, 17, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:150" default="NO">11, 3, 150</bibl>: 8, 3, 30; 12, 3, 8 al.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis numquam concessa moveri Camarina,</quote> <trans><tr>not allowed. forbidden to be removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 700</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also personally: haec ubi conceduntur esse facta, for conceditur haec esse facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia corpora vocem Mittere concedis,</quote> <trans><tr>you grant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos falli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 380</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam inesse concedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtas legendos oratori futuro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedatur profecto verum esse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9766.15" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero histrionibus oratoribusque concedendum est, ut iis haec apta sint, nobis dissoluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum concedo tibi ut ea praetereas, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedant ut viri boni fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 658</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non concedo, ut sola sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:11 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 11 al.</bibl></cit>: cui concedi potest, ut? etc., Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut concedatur ne in conspectum veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With a simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedo sit dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:114:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 114, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 523</bibl>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatos esse deos sumpsisti: concedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32, § 78</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules neque concedebant neque valde repugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.16" n="b" level="4"> = condono, <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">yield something to one as a favor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from regard, to desist from, forbear, give up; forgive, pardon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up for the sake of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitionem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>from regard to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata liberum parentum misericordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 69, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Marcellum senatui reique publicae concessisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut concessisti illum (sc. Marcellum) senatui, sic da hunc (sc. Ligarium) populo,</quote> <trans><tr>as you have pardoned him in deference to the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Montanus patri concessus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 33</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense><sense id="n9766.17" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, in respect to the terminus <hi rend="ital">ad quem, to go, walk, betake one's self somewhere, to retire, withdraw to</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">ad, in</hi>, or <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantisper hic ego ad januam concessero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit> Wagn.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Manes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli distributio docet unde fulmen venerit, quo concesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20, 45</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 380</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 122</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 270, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis animae in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 919</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in delubrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem Novam in hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argos habitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cythnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neapolin,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patavium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in turbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concede huc a foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc aliquo ab ore eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo ab eorum oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9766.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in aliquid, of entering into an alliance, yielding to, etc., <hi rend="ital">to agree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consent to, to assent, to submit, yield</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">resign one's self, to acquiesce in, to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass over to any thing</hi> (freq. in the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier, conjuncta viro, concessit in unum Conubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1010" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1010</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: victi <cb n="CONC" /> omnes in gentem nomenque imperantium concessere, <hi rend="ital">were merged in, passed over into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 12</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in paucorum potentium jus atque dicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dominationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 22</bibl></cit> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">in deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 53, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tyrias leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:6" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in condiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 23, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 36, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: in illos, <hi rend="ital">assent to, yield to them</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. Aug. contr. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concelebro: <entryFree id="n9767" type="main" key="conce^le_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĕlē^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v..a.</hi> (a strengthened celebro; rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9767.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To resort to in multitudes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frequently, to frequent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">variae volucres loca aquarum Concelebrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia et passim et tributim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 11:44" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 11, 44</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9767.2" n="b" level="4"> Of actions, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prosecute vigorously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia per otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9767.3" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid aliquā re</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol., to fill, animate, enliven, cause to abound</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">suavi cantu concelebra omnem hanc Plateam hymenaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia carmina cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alma Venus quae terras concelebras,</quote> <trans><tr>who hast filled with life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9767.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9767.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To celebrate a solemnity in great numbers, to celebrate, solemnize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem natalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies carnificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at jam quoque rem (sc. triumphum) populus Romanus omnium studio omni visendam et concelebrandam putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 4, 354</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9767.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To honor, praise, extol</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genium choreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9767.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To publish abroad, make known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae virtutis concelebrandae causā Graii ... monumentum statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 13:50" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 13, 50</bibl></cit>: multis indu locis sermonibu' concelebrarunt, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famā ac litteris victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
concellita: <entryFree id="n9768" type="main" key="concelli_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cellīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cella</etym>, <sense id="n9768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who dwells with one in a cell, a cell-mate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concelo: <entryFree id="n9769" type="main" key="conce_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cēlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to conceal carefully</hi> (perh. only in Gell.): <cit><quote lang="la">errores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:9:2" default="NO">11, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concenatio: <entryFree id="n9770" type="main" key="conce_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cēnātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-caen-,-coen-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supping together, companionship at table;</hi> transl. of <foreign lang="greek">su/ndeipnon</foreign> (like compotatio of <foreign lang="greek">sumpo/sion</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concentio: <entryFree id="n9771" type="main" key="concenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concino</etym>, <sense id="n9771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singing together, harmony</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">clarissima (catervae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 8, 24</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 71, 20.</sense></entryFree>
concentor: <entryFree id="n9772" type="main" key="concentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sings</hi> with others in a chorus (late Lat.), <foreign lang="greek">sunw|do/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Isid.</author> 7, 12, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concenturio: <entryFree id="n9773" type="main" key="concentu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-centŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">to assemble by centuries;</hi> hence, humorously, in Plaut., <hi rend="ital">to collect, bring together, to prepare</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum concenturio in corde sycophantias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae illae mihi concenturiant metum In corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 160</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
concentus: <entryFree id="n9774" type="main" key="concentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concino</etym>, <sense id="n9774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounds blending harmoniously together, symphony, harmony, harmonious music</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9774.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9774.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille sonus...qui acuta cum gravibus temperans varios aequabiliter concentus efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentum servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis lyraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 422</bibl> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et tepidum volucres concentibus aëra mulcent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:155" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubarum ac cornuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 14</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 11</bibl></cit> (al. congestu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Spald., Wolf, and Zumpt, dub.): rauci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:227" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9774.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a choir singing in harmony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:80:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 80, 196</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9774.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a concordant acclamation of people in a theatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes">46, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9774.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">concord, agreement, harmony, unanimity</hi> (also class.): quā ex conjunctione naturae et quasi concentu atque consensu, quam <foreign lang="greek">sumpa/qeian</foreign> Graeci vocant, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">actionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 145</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium doctrinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium laudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: nunc age, quid nostrum concentnm dividat audi, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 31</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi> of colors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 24, § 91</bibl>; <cb n="CONC" /> and of the <hi rend="ital">blending of sweet odors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 86</bibl> (Sillig, conceptum).</sense></entryFree>
conceptaculum: <entryFree id="n9775" type="main" key="concepta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>concipio</etym>, <sense id="n9775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which receives something, a receptacle</hi> (post-Aug. and rare). </sense><sense id="n9775.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 44, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 22 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 22 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n9775.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia aliubi conceptaculum, sed hic (sc. in superciliis) sedem habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conceptio: <entryFree id="n9776" type="main" key="concepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9776.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9776.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A comprehending;</hi> hence, concr., <hi rend="ital">a circuit, compass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa omnium naturae rerum (mundus),</quote> <trans><tr>the system of the universe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9776.2" n="B" level="2"> Aquae, <hi rend="ital">a collection, reservoir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 66" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:67" default="NO">67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:71" default="NO">71</bibl>; 73 al.—</sense><sense id="n9776.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A conception, a becoming pregnant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 22, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 40, § 83</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and imbrium (as fructifying the earth),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9776.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9776.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A composing, drawing up of juridical formulas</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:34" default="NO">12, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:56" default="NO">24, 3, 56</bibl>; 48, 2, 3 al.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9776.6" n="B" level="2"> Rei, <hi rend="ital">an expression</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9776.7" n="C" level="2"> In late gram., <hi rend="ital">a syllable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 1</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
conceptionalis: <entryFree id="n9777" type="main" key="concepti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conceptio</etym>, <sense id="n9777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to conception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; sol, Firm. Math. 7, 1.</sense></entryFree>
conceptivus: <entryFree id="n9778" type="main" key="concepti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concipio</etym>. * <sense id="n9778.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is conceived</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides et dilectio non substantiva animae sed conceptiva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9778.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is ordered, directed;</hi> so only feriae, in the Roman ritual, <hi rend="ital">those festivals that were not fixed for a certain day, but were celebrated annually on days appointed by the priests or magistrates, movable festivals</hi>. Such were the Compitalia, Paganalia, Sementivae, Latinae, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 15</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
concepto: <entryFree id="n9779" type="main" key="concepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concepto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n9779.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To conceive, become pregnant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9779.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To conceive in mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conceptum: <entryFree id="n9780" type="main" key="conceptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. concipio, I. B. <sense id="n9780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and II. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conceptus: <entryFree id="n9781" type="main" key="conceptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from concipio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9782" type="main" key="conceptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concipio</etym>. <sense id="n9782.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A collecting, gathering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberis) novenorum conceptu dierum navigabilis,</quote> <trans><tr>after the water had been stopped nine days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9782.1" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a collection, conflux</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conceptus aquarum inertium vasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9782.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking, catching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">camini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a taking fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9782.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9782.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A conceiving, pregnancy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum pecudumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeli latu Terraeque conceptu generati editique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accelerant cochleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 14, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9782.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">a budding, sprouting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conceptus id est germinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9782.6" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the fœtus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se abigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporis utero exemptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 248</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9782.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a conceiving in the mind;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a thought, purpose</hi>: animi, Firm. Math. 5, 12.</sense></entryFree>
concerno: <entryFree id="n9783" type="main" key="concerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cerno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to mix, mingle together</hi> (as in a sieve, in order to separate by sifting): <cit><quote lang="la">carni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
concerpo: <entryFree id="n9784" type="main" key="concerpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cerpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>carpo</etym>, <sense id="n9784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pluck, pull</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tear in pieces, to rend</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n9784.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:55:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 55, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia coronae concerpta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteolum,</quote> <trans><tr>lint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n9784.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to carpo, II. B. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to abuse, revile, censure</hi>: Curionem ferventissime, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concerra: <entryFree id="n9785" type="main" key="concerra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concerra</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">concerro</orth>, v. cong-.</entryFree>
concertatio: <entryFree id="n9786" type="main" key="concerta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concertātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concerto</etym>, <sense id="n9786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strife of words, a disputation, dispute, controversy</hi> (several times in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): contentiones concertationesque in disputando pertinaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concertationum plenae disputationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concertationis studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 62</bibl></cit>: imitatur disputandi prudentiam concertatio captatioque verborum, <hi rend="ital">a love of disputation</hi> (the <foreign lang="greek">e)ristikh/</foreign> of the sophists), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 23, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejuna verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 36, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum circa aegros (of the physicians at the sick-bed),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concertativus: <entryFree id="n9787" type="hapax" key="concerta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concertātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <pb n="398" /> <cb n="CONC" /> <sense id="n9787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to controversy</hi>: concertativa accusatio ( = mutua accusatio), <hi rend="ital">a recrimination, countercharge</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ntikathgori/a</foreign>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concertator: <entryFree id="n9788" type="hapax" key="concerta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concertātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concerto</etym>, <sense id="n9788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who contends</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vies with another, a rival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concertator Corbulonis: scientiā militiae (corresp. with aemulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concertatorius: <entryFree id="n9789" type="hapax" key="concerta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concertātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to controversy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disputation, controversial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (dicendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concerto: <entryFree id="n9790" type="main" key="concerto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-certo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to contend with any one zealously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warmly</hi> (rare but class.; cf. aemulor). </sense><sense id="n9790.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">te audio nescio quid concertasse cum ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: pro explorato habebat, Ambiorigem proelio non esse concertaturum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves nandi velocitate concertant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinia templis concertant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 507</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9790.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to dispute, debate</hi> (only so in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeius) saepius cum hoste conflixit, quam quisquam cum inimico concertavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo verbo uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Apolline de tripode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concertantes super cenam de nobilitate generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concertor: <entryFree id="n9791" type="main" key="concertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concertor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep.;</hi> collat. form of concerto, q. v. (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 38, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concessatio: <entryFree id="n9792" type="hapax" key="concessa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concessātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concesso</etym>, <sense id="n9792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopping, delaying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concessio: <entryFree id="n9793" type="main" key="concessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concedo, I. B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n9793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allowing, granting, conceding, permission, leave</hi> (rare, but in good prose). </sense><sense id="n9793.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 73</bibl>: praemiorum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessio, ut peculiare aliquid in fundo pascere liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">competitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,005:Fragm. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tog. Cand. Fragm. 5</bibl></cit> (8, 5, p. 21 B. and K.).— </sense><sense id="n9793.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A yielding, retiring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9793.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech, concession</hi>: cum aliquid etiam iniquum videmur causae fiduciā pati, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9793.4" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a plea of confession and excuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mitigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessio est, per quam non factum ipsum probatur ab reo, sed ut ignoscatur, id petitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concessivus: <entryFree id="n9794" type="main" key="concessi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concessīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concedo</etym>, <sense id="n9794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to concession, concessive</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 390</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
concesso: <entryFree id="n9795" type="main" key="concesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cesso</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cease, leave off, desist</hi> (ante- and post-class., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lavari aut fricari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego hic properans concesso pedibus, linguā largior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Antonin. Aug. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Antonin. Aug. 1, 2</bibl>.—Of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">concessavit praeceptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. Pers. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concessus: <entryFree id="n9796" type="main" key="concessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from concedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9797" type="main" key="concessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concedo</etym>, <sense id="n9797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a permitting, conceding, concession, permission, leave</hi> (in good prose, but used only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris concessu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur concessu omnium huic aliquis ludus aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessu et beneficio illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessu et munere deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsorum inter ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concha: <entryFree id="n9798" type="greek" key="concha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/gxh</foreign>. <sense id="n9798.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bivālve shell-fish, mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 348</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:264" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9798.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9798.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pearl-oyster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107 sq.</bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9798.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pearl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 13, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9798.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The purple-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 501</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 267</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9798.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mussel-shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 937</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea in conchis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:174" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 174</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9798.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9798.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A snail-shell</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 324.—</sense><sense id="n9798.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Triton's trumpet, in form like a snail-shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 9</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the trumpet of Misenus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 171</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9798.9" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">objects in the form of a mussel-shell</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9798.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel for holding oil, unguents, salt</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 2</bibl>; <cb n="CONC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9798.11" n="b" level="4"> = cunnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conchatus: <entryFree id="n9799" type="main" key="concha_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concha</etym>, <sense id="n9799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shellformed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concheus: <entryFree id="n9800" type="hapax" key="conche^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a shell-fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca,</quote> <trans><tr>a pearl</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 67</bibl></cit> dub. (prob. a gloss; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
conchicla: <entryFree id="n9801" type="greek" key="conchi_^cla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchī^cla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contr. from conchicula, from conchis</etym>, <sense id="n9801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the boiled bean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-chī^clātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., prepared with beans</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conchis: <entryFree id="n9802" type="greek" key="conchis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/gxos</foreign>, <sense id="n9802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bean boiled with the pods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:131" default="NO">14, 131</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conchita: <entryFree id="n9803" type="greek" key="conchi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kogxi/ths [ko/gxh]</foreign>, <sense id="n9803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a catcher of shell-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conchula: <entryFree id="n9804" type="main" key="conchu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>concha</etym>, <sense id="n9804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small shell-fish</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8:1 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conchyliarius: <entryFree id="n9805" type="gloss" key="conchy_li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchȳlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conchylium</etym>, <sense id="n9805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purple dyer</hi>, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 315, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conchyliatus: <entryFree id="n9806" type="main" key="conchy_li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchȳlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9806.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of a purple color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peristromata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 64, § 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 54, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9806.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Clothed in purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis conchyliatis cum illo seminudo loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 62:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 62, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conchylilegulus: <entryFree id="n9807" type="main" key="conchy_li^le^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchȳlĭ-lĕgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collector of shell-fish</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 7, 15; 13, 1, 9.</sense></entryFree>
conchylium: <entryFree id="n9808" type="main" key="conchy_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conchȳlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kogxu/lion</foreign>. <sense id="n9808.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shell-fish, a testaceous animal</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9808.1" n="II" level="1"> Specif. </sense><sense id="n9808.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An oyster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9808.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of purple shell-fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color conchyli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1074" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1074</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 49</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9808.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9808.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Purple color, purple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:127 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 127 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9808.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Purple garments, purple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:101 al" default="NO">8, 101 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
concido: <entryFree id="n9809" type="main" key="conci^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cado</etym>, <sense id="n9809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall together, to fall down, to tumble to the ground</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9809.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of buildings: <cit><quote lang="la">conclave illud concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis veluti terrestre machinamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris terrae motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs acerbissimo concidat incendio conflagrata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—Of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">omne caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse et equus ejus ante signum Jovis concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(alces) infirmas arbores pondere adfligunt atque unā ipsae concidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus bipenni Thessalā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad terram pondere vasto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub onere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus in fimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:333 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 333 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9809.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n9809.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall down faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lifeless, to fall in battle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">combat</hi> (cf. cado, I. B. 2.): concidit, et sonitum simul insuper arma dederunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 396 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">paene in cursu concidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi morbi coactus concidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 488</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accesserat ad religionem, quod consul concidit, et parte membrorum captus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 759</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Entellus concidit, ut quondam cava concidit ... pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 448</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanus bibit, statim concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concidere epoto poculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ad primum gustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficientibus viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par quoddam (gladiatorum) mutuis ictibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido usa manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparo percussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio adversariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of game: <cit><quote lang="la">multaeque per herbas Conciderant illo percutiente ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 94</bibl></cit>.—Of victims, <hi rend="ital">to be slaughtered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slain, to fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus ... propter mactatus concidit aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 353</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 764</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 272</bibl>;
