<cit><quote lang="la">hence also of Iphigenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9809.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. cado, II.), <hi rend="ital">to lose strength, value</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to fall to the earth, to be overthrown, to fail, be defeated, to decay, perish, fall, to go to ruin, waste away, cease;</hi> of the wind, <hi rend="ital">to fall, subside, go down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidunt venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 509</bibl>. —Of a flame: <cit><quote lang="la">jam illa flamma, quae magnā congerie convaluerat, diductis quibus alebatur, concidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. in a figure: nonne, ut ignis in aquam conjectus continuo restinguitur et refrigeratur, sic <cb n="CONC" /> refervens falsum crimen in purissimam et castissimam vitam collatum statim concidit et restinguitur? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">macie,</quote> <trans><tr>to shrink together, shrivel up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illas assumere robora gentes, Concidere has,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 422</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concidit auguris Argivi domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā concidit Ilia tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno, quo Carthago concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum vocibus fractus reus et unā patroni omnes conciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">10: ecquis umquam tam ex amplo statu concidit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malas causas semper obtinuit, in optimā concidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidit (Phocion) maxime uno crimine, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberii saevitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes concidunt animis,</quote> <trans><tr>are disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scimus Romae solutione impeditā fidem concidisse,</quote> <trans><tr>failed, was prostrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara nomina artificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis ferocia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 57 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9810" type="main" key="conci_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n9810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut up, cut through, cut away, cut to pieces, to bring to ruin, destroy</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9810.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9810.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulum Ajax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:647" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum umidiorem fossis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidere et cremare naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to break up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedum argenteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec minute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9810.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9810.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut to pieces</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to beat severely, cudgel soundly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:413" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:300" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 300</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9810.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut to pieces in war, to cut down, destroy, kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi novissimos adorti magnam multitudinem eorum fugientium conciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos inopinantes adgressus magnam partem eorum concidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9810.6" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part. (cf. caedo, I. B. 3.), <hi rend="ital">to lie with</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 166, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence caede, concide, in a double sense as an address to gladiators,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit> Zumpt; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9810.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9810.8" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to divide minutely, dismember, render feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minutos numeros sequens concidat delumbetque sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sunt qui) infringendis concidendisque numeris in quoddam genus abjectum incidant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69, 230</bibl></cit>; so also Quint. praef. § 24; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 3, 53 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9810.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strike down, to prostrate, ruin, destroy, annul</hi>, by word or deed: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem auctoritatem universi ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonium decretis vestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatinium arbitratu nostro,</quote> <trans><tr>to annihilate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sevius adlisus est, ceteri conciduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are condemned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timocraten totis voluminibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to confute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to revoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9810.10" n="2" level="3"> In Plaut., <hi rend="ital">to deceive, cheat, defraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">em istic homo te articulatim concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit> Ritschl.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (in acc. with II. A.), <hi rend="ital">divided, broken up, short, concise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concisae et angustae disputationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevia illa atque concisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thus with brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; and (opp. perpetuus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:13" default="NO">2, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of the orator Thrasymachus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 40</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insonuerit vox tubae longior atque concisior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">briefly, concisely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(philosophia) non tam est minute atque concise in actionibus utendum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conciens: <entryFree id="n9811" type="main" key="conci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. inciens</etym>, <sense id="n9811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pregnant, full</hi>: terra aquarum, App. de Mundo, 23, p. 67.</sense></entryFree>
concieo: <entryFree id="n9812" type="main" key="conci^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĭĕo</orth>, <itype>cīvi, cĭtum, 2</itype> (from the access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭo</orth>, īre: <sense id="n9812.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">concit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concirent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 15: conciri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concīta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:460" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 460</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 597</bibl>; cf. cieo and the other compounds), <pb n="399" /> <cb n="CONC" /> <hi rend="ital">v. a., to urge, bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">assemble together, by exciting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rousing, to collect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum perturbatione commovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 7</bibl></cit> (freq. in the ante-class. and post-Aug. per., esp. in Lucr. and Tac.; in Quint. and in Hor. perh. only once in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> v. under II. A.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n9812.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: populum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 12</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 141 Rib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines miraculo rei novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ex totā insulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donis auxilia concibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotos populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propiores Gallos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc concienda plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9812.2" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to move violently, to shake, stir up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur (Juppiter) tenebras et fremitus et murmura concit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quendam aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 826</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitus imbribus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(verba) quae mare turbatum, quae concita flumina sistant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis concita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:706" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murali concita Tormento saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:921" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 921</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors concita ob cruciatus,</quote> <trans><tr>hastened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 7, § 23</bibl></cit> (Sillig, conscita): <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina et tonitrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:611" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 611</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9812.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9812.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rouse, excite, stir up, provoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mela accusatorem concivit Fabium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 17</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immani concitus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 694</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aonio concita Baccha deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 312</bibl></cit>; cf.: pulso Thyias concita tympano, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divino concita motu,</quote> <trans><tr>inspired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 158</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:711" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 711</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater (corresp. with male sana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 519</bibl></cit>: (mater) fraude aliquorum concita (sc. in filium), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 65</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concita dea,</quote> <trans><tr>enraged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:543" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciti per largitionem veterani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9812.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To excite, produce, cause</hi> action, passion, disquiet, evil, etc. (the flg. taken from the agitated sea; cf. strages, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 9</bibl>; Trag. Rel. v. 399 Rib.; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 36</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 8</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">uxori turbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios motus animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
conciliabulum: <entryFree id="n9813" type="main" key="conci^li^a_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>concilium</etym>, <sense id="n9813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of assembly, a public place</hi>, esp. for public intercourse or traffic; <hi rend="ital">a marketplace, an exchange, a place for courts</hi>, etc.: conciliabulum dicitur locus, ubi in conciliam convenitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 3</bibl> Müll.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 1, 6</bibl>, and 34, 56, 2; 39, 14, 7; 40, 37, 3; 43, 14, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">martyrum,</quote> <trans><tr>where their memory is solemnly celebrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60, 12</bibl></cit>: spectaculorum, <hi rend="ital">places for public exhibitions</hi>, as the theatre, circus, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8</bibl>: damni, in comic lang., for <hi rend="ital">a brothel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in the same sense, conciliabulum alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conciliatio: <entryFree id="n9814" type="main" key="conci^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concilio</etym> (in Cic. and Quint.). <sense id="n9814.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A connection, union</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9814.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">totius generis hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quasi civili conciliatione et societate conjunctos (deos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9814.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9814.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A uniting in feeling, a conciliating, making friendly, a gaining over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae conciliationis causā leniter aut permotionis vehementer aguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum ad conciliationem satis per se valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9814.4" n="b" level="4"> As a rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the gaining over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">winning of hearers, a judge</hi>, etc., = <foreign lang="greek">oi)kei/wsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:3" default="NO">9, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9814.5" n="2" level="3"> (In acc. with conciliatus.) In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">an inclination, desire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">longing for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima est enim conciliatio hominis ad ea, quae sunt secundum naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliationes = res conciliatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit> Madv.—</sense><sense id="n9814.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An acquiring, procuring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam dedit ad conciliationem gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnis conventio conciliatio nominatur, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conciliator: <entryFree id="n9815" type="main" key="conci^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9815.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who provides, prepares</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">causes a thing; an author, founder, promoter</hi>, etc. (in good prose, but not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">however: conciliatrix and conciliatricula): suillae carnis,</quote> <trans><tr>who prepares it savorily, makes it palatable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfinitatis atque amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl>: piscis conciliator capturae (piscium), <hi rend="ital">by which other fishes are caught</hi>, <cb n="CONC" /> <hi rend="ital">a decoy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:181 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 59, 85, § 181 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9815.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A procurer</hi> (in love-matters), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conciliatricula: <entryFree id="n9816" type="main" key="conci^li^a_tri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>conciliatrix</etym>, <sense id="n9816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which concitiates, unites</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitate ipsā, blandā conciliatriculā, commendatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; Ambros. in. Psa. 15, 48.</sense></entryFree>
conciliatrix: <entryFree id="n9817" type="main" key="conci^li^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conciliator</etym>. <sense id="n9817.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that which occasions, produces, procures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(omitto) orationis vim, quae conciliatrix est humanae maxime societatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliatrix amicitiae virtutis opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9817.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">she who unites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conciliates</hi>, in a good and bad sense; <hi rend="ital">a match-maker, a procuress, a bawd</hi>: conciliatrix dicitur, quae viris conciliat uxores et uxoribus viros, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 13</bibl> Müll.—In a bad sense in Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non vides quam blanda conciliatrix et quasi sui sit lena natura?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conciliatura: <entryFree id="n9818" type="main" key="conci^li^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concilio</etym>, <sense id="n9818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the trade of procurer, pimping, pandering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conciliatus: <entryFree id="n9819" type="main" key="conci^li^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from concilio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9820" type="main" key="conci^li^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concilio</etym>, <sense id="n9820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a union</hi> of atoms, <hi rend="ital">a connection</hi> of bodies (only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, and in Lucr.): <cit><quote lang="la">condenso conciliatu artari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 576</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo (i. e. parvā mole),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principiūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 936</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conciliciatus: <entryFree id="n9821" type="hapax" key="conci^li^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĭlĭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Cilicium</etym>, <sense id="n9821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in a garment of hair</hi> (of a penitent), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concilio: <entryFree id="n9822" type="main" key="conci^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>concilium</etym>. <sense id="n9822.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together several objects into one whole, to unite, connect</hi> (class. in prose and poetry, not in Hor.). </sense><sense id="n9822.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (thus several times in Lucr. of the union of atoms): <cit><quote lang="la">primordia Non ex illarum conventu conciliata,</quote> <trans><tr>not formed by the union of separate parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 612</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:901" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 901</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 890</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 466</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1042</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:552" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 552</bibl>.—Of physical union of other kinds: <cit><quote lang="la">traduces bini inter se obvii miscentur alliganturque unā conciliati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of medic. mixtures: gramen hyoscyami cerae,</quote> <trans><tr>to mix</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 40, 754</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.2" n="2" level="3"> Of the fulling of cloth: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 43</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n9822.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9822.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To unite in thought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling, to make friendly, to procure the favor of, to make inclined to, to gain, win over;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquos inter se, aliquem alicui</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. (in this sense very freq.). </sense><sense id="n9822.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquos inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin res publica nos inter nos conciliatura conjuncturaque sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare et conjungere homines inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras inter sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>) <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare sibi, avertere ab adversario judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (legiones) sibi conciliare pecuniā cogitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pammenem sibi similitudine fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatque natum sit animal, ipsum sibi conciliari et commendari ad se conservandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam civitatem Arvernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas civitates amicitia Caesari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam (causam) cum universo ordini tum primoribus se patrum concilient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 48, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:337" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audientem exordio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. 11: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem probationibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maurorum animos Vitellio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quas res quosque homines quibus rebus aut quibus hominibus vel conciliasset vel alienasset ipsa natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: omne animal primum constitutioni suae conciliari, i. e. <hi rend="ital">governs itself in accordance with</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 124:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 124, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">15 sqq.: primum sibi ipsum conciliatur animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">17: frui iis rebus, quas primas homini natura conciliet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. conciliatio, I. B. 2.—Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliabat ceteros reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">accusatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare, docere, movere judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:7" default="NO">3, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos judicum (opp. alienare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos militum pollicitationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl>, <cb n="CONC" /> —</sense><sense id="n9822.7" n="(g)" level="5"> (<hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>: Labienum praefecit togatae, quo majore commendatione conciliaretur ad consulatūs petitionem, Auct. B. G. 8, 52.—</sense><sense id="n9822.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est ad conciliandum gratius verecundiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:161" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare, narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.9" n="2" level="3"> = commendo, <hi rend="ital">to represent something to one as agreeable, pleasant</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to recommend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dictis artes conciliasse suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.10" n="II" level="1"> With <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case> (aliquid alicui) or <hi rend="ital">absol., to procure, provide, prepare, produce something for one</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9822.11" n="A" level="2"> With physical objects. </sense><sense id="n9822.12" n="1" level="3"> Of the procuring of a maiden, an object of love, in an honorable and (more freq.) in a dishonorable sense, <hi rend="ital">to unite, procure, couple</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:961" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 961</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tute ad eum adeas, tute concilies, tute poscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num me nupsisti conciliante seni?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliata viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimabatur Servilia etiam filiam suam Tertiam Caesari conciliare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give as a mistress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei dignatio Juliā genitam Atiam conciliasset uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59, 2</bibl></cit>.—Once with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tuā me uxore dicam delatum, ut sese ad eum conciliarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To procure, obtain by purchase</hi> or <hi rend="ital">otherwise, to purchase, acquire, win, gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">male habiti et male conciliati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at a bad bargain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodi, male conciliate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Estne empta mihi haec? <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> His legibus habeas licet, Conciliavisti pulcre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:39 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 39 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi recte conciliandi primo facerem copiam,</quote> <trans><tr>a chance for a good bargain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullo pacto ille (filius) huc conciliari potest,</quote> <trans><tr>can be brought here</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 33): <cit><quote lang="la">HS. viciens ex hoc uno genere,</quote> <trans><tr>to extort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58, § 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>, § 137; 2, 3, 30, § 71; 2, 3, 84, § 194; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in a more gen. sense: summum bonum esse frui rebus iis, quas primas natura conciliavisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.14" n="B" level="2"> With abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to cause, bring about, procure, acquire, make, produce</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">affinitatem et gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem inter cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorem ad vulgum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 22, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">favorem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem auctoribus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam clementiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem nomini Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:16" default="NO">6, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otii nomine servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugales toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 70</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (in acc. with I. B.), <hi rend="ital">friendly;</hi> in partic. in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense. </sense><sense id="n9822.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Beloved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hasdrubal) flore aetatis primo Hamilcari conciliatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis aetatis flore conciliatus sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 7</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est nobis conciliatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:37" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9822.16" n="B" level="2"> In an <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">favorably inclined, devoted, favorable to something; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut judex ad rem accipiendam fiat conciliatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(homo) voluptati a naturā conciliatus, a dolore autem abjunctus alienatusque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
concilium: <entryFree id="n9823" type="main" key="conci^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>con- and root cal- of calo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kale/w</foreign>; cf. clamo</etym>, <sense id="n9823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collection of people, an association, gathering, union, meeting, assembly</hi>, = coetus (class.). </sense><sense id="n9823.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">videre ambas in uno concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clst. 4, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camenarum cum Egeria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab sede piorum, coetu concilioque abigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caelestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinum animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilia coetusque hominum jure sociati, quae civitates appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cyclopum) Concilium horrendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoena piorum Concilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:355" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 178</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">inque ferarum Concilio medius sedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 144</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and trop.: tamquam meretricem in matronarum coetum, sic voluptatem in virtutum concilium adducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9823.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9823.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An assembly for consultation, a council</hi> (in concreto; on the contrary consilium signifies<pb n="400" /> <cb n="CONC" />  the counsel in abstracto that is taken in such an assembly. The meanings, however, often pass over to each other; hence in MSS. and edd. a freq. confusion of the two words; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">consilium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(opiniones), quae in senatu, quae apud populum, quae in omni coetu concilioque proferendae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transferre Lutetiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum diem differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere diem concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messene ab Achaeis, quod concilii eorum recusaret esse, oppugnari coepta est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a member of the Achaian league</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilio excesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 22, 12</bibl></cit>: sanctum Patrum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n9823.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A close conjunction</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">union, connection</hi> (esp. freq. in Lucr.): <cit><quote lang="la">coetu concilioque Nil facient (primordia rerum), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 920</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiaï concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in concilium coire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:564 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 564 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 772</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1081" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1081</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:565" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 565</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bond of union, tie</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi tecum concilium manebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 710</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9823.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sexual union, coition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia quae genitali Concilio possent arceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9823.6" n="(b)" level="5"> (As an incentive to this.) <hi rend="ital">The blossom of the plant</hi> iasione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 39, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concinens: <entryFree id="n9824" type="main" key="conci^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭnens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. concino <sense id="n9824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
concinentia: <entryFree id="n9825" type="main" key="conci^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concino</etym> (postclass. for concentus), <sense id="n9825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">musical harmony, concord</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9825.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in archit., <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">architectonica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concineratus: <entryFree id="n9826" type="hapax" key="conci^ne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĭnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinis</etym>, <sense id="n9826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sprinkled with ashes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concingo: <entryFree id="n9827" type="main" key="concingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to gird, surround completely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concinnaticius: <entryFree id="n9828" type="hapax" key="concinna_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnātĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concinno</etym>, <sense id="n9828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilfully prepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concinnatio: <entryFree id="n9829" type="main" key="concinna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n9829.0" n="I" level="1"> In economics, <hi rend="ital">an adjusting, preparing</hi>: aquae marinae, Auct. Lemmat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9829.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a making, composing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl> and 15: metrorum, Mar. Vict. p. 2547 P.</sense></entryFree>
concinnator: <entryFree id="n9830" type="main" key="concinna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n9830.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An arranger, disposer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitum et capillorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a hair-dresser</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 5. —</sense><sense id="n9830.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maker, contriver, author, inventor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <trans><tr>an advocate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnatores atque inventores tantarum deformitatum (poetae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concinne: <entryFree id="n9831" type="main" key="concinne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>concinnus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>
concinnitas: <entryFree id="n9832" type="main" key="concinni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concinnus</etym>, <sense id="n9832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neat, elegant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">skilful joining of several things</hi> (in good prose, but rare). </sense><sense id="n9832.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnitates colorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est ornamentum virile concinnitas,</quote> <trans><tr>a too carefully arranged dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitare concinnitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9832.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">beauty of style, produced by a skilful connection of words and clauses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49, 164</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">95, 325</bibl> (not in Quint.).</sense></entryFree>
concinniter: <entryFree id="n9833" type="main" key="concinni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>concinnus</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, 2.</entryFree>
concinnitudo: <entryFree id="n9834" type="hapax" key="concinni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concinnus</etym>, = concinnitas, II., <sense id="n9834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beauty of style</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concinno: <entryFree id="n9835" type="main" key="concinno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concinno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join fitly together, to order, arrange appropriately, to set right, adjust</hi>: concinnare est apte componere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 1</bibl> Müll. (cf. compono, II. B.; mostly anteclass. and post-Aug.; most. freq. in Plaut.; not in Ter., Cic., or Quint.; in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Oecon. Fragm. 7, p. 474</bibl> Orell., the words prob. belong to Col.; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 6</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n9835.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et commodare trapetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 135</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae refectionem desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas struices patinarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auceps aream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <trans><tr>to adorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113, 5</bibl></cit>: cadaver. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9835.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>to form. cultivate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9835.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to prepare, cause, occasion, produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livorem scapulis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: venti Vis fervorem mirum in undis, Lucr. <cb n="CONC" /> 6, 437; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis (venti) hiatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 584</bibl></cit>: munusculum tibi, Trebon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1279</bibl></cit>: aliquid controversiae, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 433, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum mihi negotii concinnabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9835.4" n="B" level="2"> With a qualifying <pos>adj.</pos> in Plaut., and once in Naev., = reddere, <hi rend="ital">to make, render, cause to be</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me insanum verbis concinnat suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumantem ex abitu concinnas tuam uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines delirantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis orbas oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: annonam caram e vili, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam erit alienis gravis, qui suis se concinnat levem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Trin. 3:2:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: vastam rem hostium, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 30</bibl> dub. (al. vastat).</sense></entryFree>
concinnus: <entryFree id="n9836" type="main" key="concinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cinnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 43, 21</bibl>, and p. 59, 30, from cinnus</etym>, <sense id="n9836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fitly, skilfully put together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joined, well adjusted, beautiful</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic. of discourse). </sense><sense id="n9836.1" n="I" level="1"> Object. </sense><sense id="n9836.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sat edepol concinna est (virgo) facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samos ( = venusta, elegans),</quote> <trans><tr>pretty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: helicis folia angulosa et concinniora (for <foreign lang="greek">eu)ruqmo/tera</foreign>, in Theophr. H. P. 3, 18), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heluo,</quote> <trans><tr>elegant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9836.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">beautiful, elegant, polishcd, neat, striking</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) concinna, distincta, ornata, festiva, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae non tam graves et severae quam concinnae et venustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnae sententiae (opp. probabiles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 65</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnae acutaeque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus ad rem aptus et concinnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transgressio verborum, id est hyperbaton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9836.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">alii in eādem jejunitate concinniores, id est, faceti, florentes etiam et leviter ornati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnus et elegans Aristo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also of the painter Nicophanes: elegans et concinnus (pictor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9836.5" n="II" level="1"> Subject. ( = commodus, II.): concinnus alicui, <hi rend="ital">suited to, fit, appropriate for;</hi> of persons, <hi rend="ital">suiting one's self to, courteous, pleasing</hi>, etc. (rare): viris Venus ut concinnior esset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1276</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnus amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 50</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n9836.6" n="B" level="2"> Concinnum est = commodum est: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age, ut tibi maxime concinnum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is pleasing, agreeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9836.7" n="1" level="3"> In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fitly, beautifully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinne et lepide vestita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>. —Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">elegantly, neatly</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 49</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. ad Gratian. 8</bibl></cit>: saliunt aquae, Fronto de Orat. 1, p. 242 Mai.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> apparently not in use.—</sense><sense id="n9836.8" n="2" level="3"> In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">concinnĭter</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concino: <entryFree id="n9837" type="main" key="conci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĭno</orth>, <itype>cĭnŭi</itype>, no <sense id="n9837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cano]. </sense><sense id="n9837.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to sing, play</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sound together, in concert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harmoniously</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9837.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi (chorus) certis numeris ac pedibus velut facta conspiratione consensit atque concinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinere tragoedo pronuntianti,</quote> <trans><tr>to accompany</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua ac tubae concinuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concinunt tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi signa concinuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also without the idea of concert: concinit albus olor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9837.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to agree together, harmonize, accord</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">suna/|dw</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus inter se concinentibus mundi partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videsne ut haec concinant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faxo, ne juvet vox ista veto, quā nunc concinentes collegas nostros tam laeti auditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit ut nulli duo concinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici cum Peripateticis re concinere videntur, verbis discrepare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9837.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to cause to sound together, in concert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harmoniously, to make concordant sounds, to sound, sing of, celebrate in song, magnify</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9837.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum pressis et flebilibus modis, qui totis theatris maestitiam inferant, concinuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite, concinite in modum: Io Hymen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 123</bibl></cit>;
