<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina nuptialia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 65, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes Iovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aelinon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: sua festa <cb n="CONC" /> Palilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore plectro Caesarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor lituum clangorque tubarum Non pia concinuit cum rauco classica cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 238</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9837.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. (acc. to cano, II. C.), <hi rend="ital">to sing prophetically, prophesy</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nigraque funestum concinit omen avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 28, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., harmonizing, harmonious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 123</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concio: <entryFree id="n9838" type="main" key="conci^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. concieo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9839" type="main" key="conci^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭo</orth>, and its derivv., <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭō-nābundus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">concĭōnālis</orth>, etc., v. under contio, contionabundus, contionalis, etc.</entryFree>
concipilo: <entryFree id="n9840" type="main" key="conci^pi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭpĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>concipio</etym>, <sense id="n9840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seize, take, catch</hi> (only in the foll. exs.): concipilavisti dictum a Naevio pro corripuisti et involasti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego offatim jam jam concipilabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concipio: <entryFree id="n9841" type="main" key="conci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, <sense id="n9841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay hold of, to take to one's self, to take in, take, receive</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9841.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9841.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces si fregeris, vix sesquimodio concipere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truleum latius, quo concipiat aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 503</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">concipit Iris aquas,</quote> <trans><tr>draws up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madefacta terra caducas Concepit lacrimas, id. ib 6, 397: imbres limumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of water, <hi rend="ital">to take up, draw off</hi>, in a pipe, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alsietinam aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl> sqq.—<hi rend="ital">Pass., to be collected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held, to gather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (animae) concipitur cordis parte quādam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque (umor) ibi conceptus fuerit, quam celerrime dilabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cepta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst., measures</hi> of fluids, <hi rend="ital">capacity</hi> of a reservoir, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius quam in conceptis commentariorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the measures described in the registers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 67" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:73" default="NO">73</bibl>.—Of the approach of death: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam praecordiis conceptam mortem contineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam vim venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 569</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:337" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 308</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 348</bibl>.—Of lime slaked: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi terrenā silices fornace soluti concipiunt ignem liquidarum aspergine aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:108 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 108 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidibus igne concepto,</quote> <trans><tr>struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 255</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the flame of love: flammam pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 520</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 582</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">validos ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxium virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 44, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā parte nivem concipi,</quote> <trans><tr>is formed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>. —Of disease: <cit><quote lang="la">is morbus aestate plerumque concipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex calore et aestu concepta pestis invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9841.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9841.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive</hi> (<hi rend="ital">animal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vegetable</hi>) <hi rend="ital">fecundation, to conceive, become pregnant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9841.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">more ferarum putantur Concipere uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1266</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum concepit mula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illo concipit ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 328</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbores) concipiunt variis diebus et pro suā quaeque naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9841.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut id, quod conceperat, servaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persea, quem pluvio Danaë conceperat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex adulterio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova (pisces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 75, § 165</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">concepta crimina portat, i. e. fetum per crimen conceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 470</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 268</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae terra concipiat semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta quaedam in tertio genu spicam incipiunt concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the fetus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne praegnanti medicamentum, quo conceptum excutitur, detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Ep. ad Callist. p. 3" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Ep. ad Callist. p. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coacta conceptum a se abigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9841.7" n="b" level="4"> In Ovid, meton., of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to unite herself in marriage, to marry, wed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dea undae, Concipe. Mater eris juvenis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 222</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9841.8" n="2" level="3"> Concipere furtum, in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to find out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discover stolen property</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 1, § 4</bibl>; cf.: penes quem res concepta et inventa<pb n="401" /> <cb n="CONC" />  est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:9 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 9 sq.</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9841.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9841.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seize something by the sense of sight, to see, perceive</hi> (cf. comprehendo, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec tanta oculis bona concipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n9841.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive in mind</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9841.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to comprehend intellectually, to take in, imagine, conceive, think</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, inaugura fierine possit, quod nunc ego mente concipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 18, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem quandam concipere animo perfecti oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:19 al" default="NO">9, 1, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mirum si in auspiciis imbecilli animi superstitiosa ista concipiant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantalibet magnitudo hominis concipiatur animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 8</bibl></cit> Drak. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo summa concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: onus operis opinione prima concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 1: protinus concepit Italiam et arma virumque, <hi rend="ital">conceived the plan</hi> of the Æneid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9841.13" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to understand, comprehend, perceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam principia rerum omnium animo ac mente conceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae neque concipi animo nisi ab iis qui videre, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor, qui concipi humanā mente non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concipere animo potes, quam simus fatigati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 24</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ita juratum est, ut mens conciperet fleri oportere, id servandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan et lucos illic concipias animo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concepit, eos homines posse jure mulceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9841.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To receive in one's self, adopt, harbor any disposition of mind, emotion, passion, evil design</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to give place to, foster, to take in, receive; to commit</hi> (the figure derived from the absorbing of liquids; <cit><quote lang="la">hence): quod non solum vitia concipiunt ipsi, sed ea infundunt in civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiae et aedilitate et praeturā conceptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mente vaticinos furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo ingentes iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:554" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 554</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spemque metumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:485" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore tantum robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus tantam cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=101 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 101 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re publicā violandā fraudis inexpiabiles concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum aut scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus in sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9841.15" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw up, comprise, express something in words, to compose</hi> (cf. comprehendo, II. C.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex animi tui sententiā juraris, sicut verbis concipiatur more nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl></cit> (15), 3: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisjurandi verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligationem in futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem in bonum et aequum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit> (id est conceptis verbis: <cit><quote lang="la">concepta autem verba dicuntur jurandi formula, quam nobis transgredi non licet, Serv.): audet tamen Antias Valerius concipere summas (of the slain, etc.),</quote> <trans><tr>to report definitely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—T. t., of the lang. of religion, <hi rend="ital">to make something</hi> (as a festival, auspices, war, etc.) <hi rend="ital">known, to promulgate, declare in a set form of words, to designate formally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi viae competunt tum in competis sacrificatur: quotannis is dies (sc. Compitalia) concipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 25</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vota sacerdos Concipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic verba concipito,</quote> <trans><tr>repeat the following prayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 139, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">141, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinas sacrumque in Albano monte non rite concepisse (magistratus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. conceptivus): <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus quibusdam conceptis verbis finitus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 8</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut justum conciperetur bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">86 ib.—So of a formal repetition of set words after another person: senatus incohantibus primoribus jus jurandum concepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus miles dixit sacramentum ... et cum cetera juris jurandi verba conciperent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: verba jurationis concipit, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., he takes the oath, that</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 30</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">conceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., formal, in set form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis conceptissimis jurare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: mente concepta, <hi rend="ital">things apprehended by the mind, perceptions</hi>: consuetudo <cb n="CONC" /> jam tenuit, ut mente concepta sensus vocaremus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concise: <entryFree id="n9842" type="main" key="conci_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. concido, <sense id="n9842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
concisio: <entryFree id="n9843" type="main" key="conci_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. concido</etym>, prop., <sense id="n9843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n9843.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cutting to pieces, destruction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9843.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9843.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mutilation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9843.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a separating of a sentence into short divisions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clauses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concisor: <entryFree id="n9844" type="hapax" key="conci_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fells</hi>: nemorum, Coripp. 4, 22.</sense></entryFree>
concisorius: <entryFree id="n9845" type="hapax" key="conci_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for cutting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 56, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concisura: <entryFree id="n9846" type="main" key="conci_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n9846.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dividing, distributing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9846.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hollow, chink, cleft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concisus: <entryFree id="n9847" type="main" key="conci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. concido, <sense id="n9847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
concitamentum: <entryFree id="n9848" type="main" key="conci^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>concito</etym>, <sense id="n9848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incentive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concitate: <entryFree id="n9849" type="main" key="conci^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. concito, <sense id="n9849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
concitatio: <entryFree id="n9850" type="main" key="conci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concito</etym>, lit., <sense id="n9850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hastening, quick movement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9850.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9850.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an exciting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rousing up;</hi> esp., of the passions, <hi rend="ital">an emotion of mind, affection, passion</hi> (in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Cic. and Quint.): sapientem ab omni concitatione animi, quam perturbationem voco, semper vacare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concitationes vehementiores animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum (i. e. ira),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:11" default="NO">2, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:31" default="NO">7, 4, 31</bibl>; 10, 1, 114; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 3, 146 (opp. misericordia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9850.3" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a sedition, a tumult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebei contra patres concitatione et seditione nuntiatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae (multitudinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 106 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
concitator: <entryFree id="n9851" type="main" key="conci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who excites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rouses, a mover, exciter</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:38" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbae ac tumultūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitator et instimulator seditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernariorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 13; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo concitata ipsum concitatorem antecessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concitatrix: <entryFree id="n9852" type="main" key="conci^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concitator</etym>, <sense id="n9852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which excites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stirs up</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris (eruca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 154</bibl></cit>; and <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitatricem vim habet satyrion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concitatus: <entryFree id="n9853" type="main" key="conci^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from concito.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9854" type="hapax" key="conci^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concito</etym>, = concitatio, <sense id="n9854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impulse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 365</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concito: <entryFree id="n9855" type="main" key="conci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>concieo</etym>, <sense id="n9855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move violently, to put in violent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quick motion, to stir up, rouse up, excite, incite, shake</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9855.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (thus most freq. in the poets and histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 292</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 301</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum calcaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equum in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitant equos permittuntque in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos adversos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. also under <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves quantā maximā celeritate poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 44, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">classem concitatam remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 25, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alteram (navem) quinqueremis eadem concitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:436" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:286" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversas Eurus aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare aeriore vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves pluvias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in Teucros alis (Alecto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to take to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se fugā in aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:383" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 383</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9855.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class. and very freq. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9855.3" n="A" level="2"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to rouse, urge, impel one to any act, feeling</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to move strongly, to influence, stir up, instigate</hi>, etc.; constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ad, in, adversus</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9855.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and a <hi rend="ital">subst., gerund</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitari ad studium cognoscendae percipiendaeque virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 204</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concitatus ad philosophiam studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 89, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem ad fortiter judicandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum ad depellendam ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ad quaerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem Galliam ad nostrum auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem ad arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 42</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: cessantes ad arma, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 16</bibl>: colonias ad audendum<cb n="CONC" />  aliquid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad convicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad despiciendam vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9855.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in iram concitat se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9855.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruriam omnem adversus nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum adversus regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 59, 12</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n9855.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vos dementia concitat captam dimittere Trojam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 226</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, both with and without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum animi quodam impetu concitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 6, 9</bibl></cit> (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 689</bibl> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem fallaci spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam seditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aliquo adfectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectu pignorum suorum concitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo enim spectat illud ... nisi ut opifices concitentur?</quote> <trans><tr>should be excited to sedition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 18 sq.</bibl>; Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">servitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices (opp. flectere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. placare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 170</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. mitigare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:9" default="NO">4, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:12" default="NO">6, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare animos ac remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas aures de nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 15, 45.—</sense><sense id="n9855.8" n="B" level="2"> Aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to rouse, excite, cause, occasion, produce</hi> any action, passion, evil, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:22" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:5:1 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 5, 1 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas turbas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 11</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam pugnam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas totius populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>, : <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium (just before, commovere odium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam in te ex illis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam, odium, iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram (opp. lenire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem ac discordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 33, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera iambis maxime concitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:136" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error vanis concitatus imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pituitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 189</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9855.9" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Violently moved</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rapid, swift, quick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo concitato ad hostem vehitur,</quote> <trans><tr>at full speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (more freq. citato equo; v. 2. <itype>cito</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">quam concitatissimos equos immittere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversio caeli concitatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitatissimus corporis motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9855.10" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Roused up, excited, vehement, ardent</hi> (freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">testimonia non concitatae contionis sed jurati senatūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in comoediis pater) interim concitatus, interim lenis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus (opp. mites atque compositi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. flebiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus an remissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 58</bibl></cit> and 60: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO">10, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erectā et concitatā voce (opp. summissā atque contractā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:175" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucanus ardens et concitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 91</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitatior accidens clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO">8, 3, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n9855.11" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to 1.) <hi rend="ital">Quickly, rapidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitur pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9855.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to 2.) <hi rend="ital">Impetuously, ardently</hi> (most freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:23" default="NO">10, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO">11, 3, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 71: itur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:68" default="NO">3, 8, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:130" default="NO">9, 4, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.— *<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: raperet ventus, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 26.</sense></entryFree>
concitor: <entryFree id="n9856" type="main" key="conci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concieo</etym>, <sense id="n9856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who rouses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excites, an exciter</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">in MSS. freq. interchanged with concitator): belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:17" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 45, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10</bibl></cit> 10.</sense></entryFree>
concitus: <entryFree id="n9857" type="main" key="conci^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">concītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. concieo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9858" type="main" key="conci^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭtus</orth>, üs, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concieo</etym>, = concitatio, <sense id="n9858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciting, spurring on; impetuosity, haste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Genethl. Maxim. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conciuncula: <entryFree id="n9859" type="main" key="conci^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭuncŭla</orth>, v. contiuncula.</entryFree>
concivis: <entryFree id="n9860" type="main" key="conci_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cīvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-citizen</hi>, transl. of <foreign lang="greek">sumpoli/ths</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res Carn. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conclamans: <entryFree id="n9861" type="main" key="concla_mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāmans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <sense id="n9861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of conclamo. <pb n="402" /> <cb n="CONC" /></sense></entryFree>
conclamatio: <entryFree id="n9862" type="main" key="concla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conclamo</etym>, <sense id="n9862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud shouting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calling of many persons together, a shout</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): universi exercitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot milium sub gladio gementium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conclamatus: <entryFree id="n9863" type="main" key="concla_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conclamo.</entryFree>
conclamito: <entryFree id="n9864" type="hapax" key="concla_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [conclamo], <hi rend="ital">to call, cry out loudly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conclamo: <entryFree id="n9865" type="main" key="concla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n9865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call out together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9865.1" n="I" level="1"> (Con subject.) <hi rend="ital">To call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a body</hi> (hence often joined with omnes, universi, pariter, omnes pariter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:22" default="NO">8, 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:17:3" default="NO">10, 17, 3</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to shout</hi>, esp. in approbation or assent (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9865.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vos universi, unā mente atque voce, iterum a me conservatam esse rem publicam conclamastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ducendum ad sedes simulacrum ... conclamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:233 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 233 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Mithridates se velle dixit, id sutores et zonarii conclamarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam suo more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetum paeana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:738 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 738 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum suo more conclamaverunt, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—So with simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamantibus omnibus, imperaret quod vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur, conclamant, duceret quo videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamat vir paterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quorum casum, cum conclamasset gaudio exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">planctu conclamat uterque Isthmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9865.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9865.4" n="1" level="3"> Conclamare ad arma, milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to call to arms, to give the signal for an attack</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 32, 9</bibl>; 41, 26, 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n9865.5" n="2" level="3"> Conclamare vasa, <hi rend="ital">to give the signal, before breaking up, for packing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give the order for decamping</hi> (ellipt. for conclamare, ut vasa colligantur), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl>. In the same sense without vasa, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 67</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9865.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call together, to call to one's help</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duros agrestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 504</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9865.7" n="III" level="1"> (Con intens.) Of a single person, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out loudly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violently, to shout, exclaim</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9865.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi abit, conclamo: Heus quid agis tu, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam primus conclamat Achates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi! conclamat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 843</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capta castra conclamavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariovistus conclamavit, quid ad se venirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>to call upon, invoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 974" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 974</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa querelis,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill with cries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:46:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamat virgo,</quote> <trans><tr>cries out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 691</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9865.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> (mortuum), t. t. in the lang. of religion; of the dead, <hi rend="ital">to call repeatedly by name, and lament him seven</hi> (acc. to others, eight) <hi rend="ital">days, until his burial</hi> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 218</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. Antiq. p. 459, a.): ut ex maestis paulo ante domibus, quae conclamaverant suos, procurreretur in vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum corpora nondum conclamata jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post conclamata imperatoris suprema,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after this cry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem conclamare tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9865.10" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bewail, complain;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videris immensis conclamata querelis Saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:45:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 45, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9865.11" n="c" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam conclamatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is all over, all is lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit> Don.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9865.12" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāmans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamantissimus fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9865.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāmā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n9865.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Published abroad by crying out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">known, celebrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamatissimus primipilaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamatissimae declamationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9865.15" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to III. B.) <hi rend="ital">Lamentable, unfortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conclausus: <entryFree id="n9866" type="main" key="conclausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. concludo <sense id="n9866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conclavatae: <entryFree id="n9867" type="gloss" key="concla_va_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāvātae</orth> <itype>dicebantur, quae sub eādem erant clave</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 1</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
conclave: <entryFree id="n9868" type="main" key="concla_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāve</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n9868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> heterocl. conclaviorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclavium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>clavis: conclavia dicuntur loca, quae unā clave clauduntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 9</bibl> Müll.; cf. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 35</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a room, chamber, dining hall, cage for animals, stall</hi>, <cb n="CONC" /> <hi rend="ital">coop</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">that may be locked up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9868.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:2 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 2 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> conclavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9868.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 58</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl>; Vitr. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:3 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conclavo: <entryFree id="n9869" type="gloss" key="concla_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclāvo</orth>, <sense id="n9869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nail together</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sunhlw=</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
conclericus: <entryFree id="n9870" type="main" key="concle_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-clērĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-clergyman</hi>, Jul. Epit. Nov. c. 115, § 475.</sense></entryFree>
concludenter: <entryFree id="n9871" type="main" key="conclu_denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conclūdenter</orth>, v. concludo <sense id="n9871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
concludo: <entryFree id="n9872" type="main" key="conclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n9872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> solecist. conclausa semina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to shut up closely, to close up, enclose, confine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9872.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class. in prose and poetry), constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, with <pos>adv.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. (not with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, for the true read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, is inclusit): <cit><quote lang="la">in vincla bestiam nequissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestias delectationis causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 56</bibl></cit> Madv.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos concludit, magnam hominum multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia enim in caveā si forent Conclussi itidem ut pulli gallinacei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusam hic habeo uxorem saevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in fenestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in cellam cum illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aediculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sulco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu conclusas hircinis follibus auras ... imitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscina conclusa porticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigris et Euphrates Mesopotamiam ab utroque latere concludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera cerā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:479" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti procella conclusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concluso loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia conclusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave locus voci resonat conclusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusa aqua (opp.: profluens amnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longe aliam esse navigationem concluso mari atque in vastissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coagmentis ad centrum respondentibus fornices concluduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statio conclusa atque munita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:59" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9872.2" n="b" level="4"> Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">non placet qui amicos intra dentis conclusos habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9872.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9872.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To include, compress, restrain, comprise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fere, quae sunt conclusa nunc artibus, dispersa et dissipata quondam fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna tot res, in unum conclusit diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab illā excludar, huc concludar,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I shall be fettered by this marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit> (ex ferarum translatione concludar dixit, Don.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concludere jus civile in parvum et angustum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 22, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno hoc volumine vitam excellentium virorum complurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hanc formulam omnia judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eidem et infinitam largitionem remittebas et eundem in angustissimam formulam sponsionis concludebas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum locum in unam speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9872.5" n="B" level="2"> (Cf. claudo, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To end, close, conclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus natum a cupiditate, auctum per stuprum, crudelitate perfectum atque conclusum,</quote> <bibl
