n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ancipites variique casus) exitu notabili concluduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia in quā laus equitatis, integritatis, facilitatis ad extremum ludorum voluptate concluditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 322" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 322</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of letters, speech, the written or spoken treatment of any subject, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen decumanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illa redeamus eaque ipsa concludamus aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perorationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9872.6" n="C" level="2"> In rhet., of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to close rhythmically, to round off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum ordinem alias aliā terminatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69, 230</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl>: concludam si potero Latine; <cit><quote lang="la">Graecum enim hunc versum nostis omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensum non expleto numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 123</bibl> and 125: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum acuto tenore (just before: acuto sono finiant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9872.7" n="D" level="2"> In philos. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to conclude, infer, make an inference, to argue, demonstrate;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas argumentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo efficiatur concludaturque ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: id quod concludere illi velint, non effici ex <cb n="CONC" /> propositis, nec esse consequens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 215</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rebus concessis concludi quod velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde concludebas, summum malum esse dolorem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 83</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">concludere hoc modo: si sunt di, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:49:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 49, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea sumunt ad concludendum, quorum iis nihil conceditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 49, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:3" default="NO">5, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:106" default="NO">10, 1, 106</bibl>; 12, 2, 25.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-clūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">confined, closed</hi>, in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus conclusior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conclūsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to II. D.), <hi rend="ital">a conclusion in a syllogism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 27</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9872.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conclūdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by consequence, consequently</hi>, Boëth. Arist. Elench. Soph. 1, 10, p. 744.—* </sense><sense id="n9872.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conclūsē</orth> (acc. to II. C.), <hi rend="ital">with periods rhetorically rounded, harmoniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concluse apteque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:177" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
